text:
Delhi Liquor Scam: Cabinet Ministers Kailash Gahlot, Raaj Kumar Anand Likely To Be Given Manish Sisodia's Portfolios | India News | Zee Newsहिन्दीEnglishमराठीবাংলাதமிழ்മലയാളംગુજરાતીతెలుగుಕನ್ನಡBusinessTechWorldHealthNEWSVIDEOSPHOTOSWeb StoriesLogoutSign InLogoutGOHomeLive TVWomen Achievers AwardsLatest NewsIndiaAhmedabadBengaluruChennaiHyderabadKolkataMumbaiPuneMY MONEYCricketEntertainmentHollywoodMusicBollywoodTelevisionRegionalMovie ReviewSportsFootballTennisBadmintonOther SportsLifestyleRelationshipTravelFood & RecipesFashionCultureSpiritualityBusinessEconomyMarketsCompaniesReal EstateInternational BusinessPersonal FinanceAutomobileWorldAsiaAfricaAmericasAustralia-OceaniaEuropeMobilityViral newsDiabytesTechnologyGadgetGamingInternet & Social MediaAppsMobileLive TVWomen Achievers AwardsLatest NewsIndiaMY MONEYCricketEntertainmentSportsLifestyleBusinessWorldMobilityViral newsDiabytesHomeLive TVWomen Achievers AwardsLatest NewsIndiaMY MONEYCricketEntertainmentSportsLifestyleBusinessWorldMobilityViral newsDiabytesTechnologyXtopStoriesenglish2578094NewsIndiaMANISH SISODIA RESIGNATIONDelhi Liquor Scam: Cabinet Ministers Kailash Gahlot, Raaj Kumar Anand Likely To Be Given Manish Sisodia's Portfolios Delhi Liquor Policy Scam: AAP leader Manish Sisodia resigned as Deputy Chief Minister of Delhi amid the allegations of corruption in the ongoing Liquor Scam Case.
Edited By:  Zee Media Bureau|Last Updated: Feb 28, 2023, 07:21 PM IST|Source: Bureau ×Trending Photos7Shardul ThakurShardul Thakur, Mittali Parulkar's Wedding: India All-Rounder Shares BEAUTIFUL Photos From Dreamy Wedding - Check6EntertainmentJackky Bhagnani Hosts Party For Singer CKay; Rumoured Couple Ananya Panday-Aditya Roy Kapur Attend: In Pics 6SportsLionel Messi Wins FIFA Award For 7th Time: Check TOP Achievements, in PICS12EntertainmentHoroscope Today, February 28 by Astro Sundeep Kochar: Stop Being Jealous, AquariusNew Delhi: In a major development, the Aam Aadmi Party has decided to hand over senior AAP leader Manish Sisodia's portfolios to Delhi cabinet ministers Kailash Gahlot & Raaj Kumar Anand, news agency ANI reported. No new ministers will be sworn in the cabinet. Earlier, Manish Sisodia resigned as Deputy Chief Minister of Delhi amid the allegations of corruption in the ongoing Liquor Scam Case. Along with Sisodia, Health Minister Satyendar Jain has also quit from his post. Jain is lodged in jail in a separate corruption case. Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has accepted resignations of both the leaders. The CBI on Sunday evening arrested Sisodia in connection with alleged corruption in the formulation and implementation of the now-scrapped liquor policy for 2021-22.


Portfolios of former Delhi Dy CM Manish Sisodia likely to be given to Delhi cabinet ministers Kailash Gahlot & Raaj Kumar Anand. No new minister will be sworn in as of now: Sources pic.twitter.com/Fyj5AVe8fb
— ANI (@ANI) February 28, 2023

SC Refuses To Hear Sisodia's Plea 
Earlier today, the Supreme Court declined to hear the bail plea of Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia, who is in CBI custody, in connection with the excise policy case, news agency PTI reported. The Aam Aadmi Party will now move to Delhi HC over Sisodia's arrest, news agency ANI reported.

Also Read: Liquor Scam: Manish Sisodia Resigns As Delhi Deputy CM, Satyendar Jain Too Quits As Health Minister
A bench comprising Chief Justice D Y Chandrachud and Justice P S Narasimha has refused to intervene in Sisodia’s case, and asked him to 'avail alternative remedies'. The Delhi Deputy Chief Minister approached SC on Tuesday for bail in the excise policy case.

 The top court observed that the arrested AAP leader has remedies under the Code of Criminal Procedure (CrPC) to move the Delhi High Court for bail and seek the quashing of the FIR. A special Delhi court on Monday sent Sisodia to five-day CBI remand in the excise policy case to allow the agency to get "genuine and legitimate" answers to questions being put to him for "a proper and fair.

Earlier this month, the agency had interrogated Delhi minister Satyendar Jain in Tihar Jail in connection with the case after taking permission from the judge.

Jain was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate in a money laundering case. He is not an accused in the excise policy case.
The CBI had also quizzed AAP's communication in-charge Vijay Nair, who is also lodged in Tihar Jail, in connection with the excise policy money laundering case being probed by the ED.

Nair was earlier granted bail in the CBI excise policy case by the court.Live Tvmanish sisodia resignationmanish sisodia arrestKailash GahlotRaaj Kumar Ananddelhi liquor policy caseSatyendar Jainaap protestsdelhi liquor scammanish sisodia newsMore Stories Manish Sisodia Quits Sisodia Resigns As Delhi Deputy CM, Satyendar Jain Too Quits As Minister Bill Gates Bill Gates Visits RBI HQ In Mumbai; Meets Governor ShaktiKanta Das  Gurugram Men Riding Luxury Car Allegedly Steal Flower Pots From G20 Event in Gurugram snap Snap Joins AI Race; Announces To Integrate OpenAI's ChatGPT With Platform manish sisodia arrest Delhi Excise Policy Case: Manish Sisodia Resigns As Deputy Delhi CM India vs Australia 2023 LIVE Updates | IND VS AUS 3rd Test, Day 1 Cricket Match Live Score Ben stokes I’m Not Going To Lie...: Ben Stokes Opens Up On His Availability For CSK KL Rahul Rohit Sharma REVEALS Real Reason Behind Removing KL Rahul As Vice CaptainComments - Join the DiscussionTrending newsDNA VideoDNA: Famous writer Anant Pai passed away on this day in the year 2011DNA VideoDNA: For the first time in the year 1886, Aluminum was made in the laboratoryDNA VideoDNA: When India's first education minister Abul Kalam Azad died in 1958DNA VideoDNA: When will the Russia-Ukraine war end?DNA VideoDNA: Fear of corona infection, Home becomes 'Jail'

Bihar Police arrests Galwan martyr's father for 'illegally' constructing son's memorial  - India Today India TodayDailyOIndiaTodayNEMalayalamBusiness TodayAaj TakLallantopBanglaGNTTViChowkReader’s DigestSports TakCrime TakAstro TakGamingHarper's BazaarBrides TodayCosmopolitanIshq FMAaj Tak CampusKisan TakMagazineLIVELive TVSearchSEARCHTRENDING TOPICSSIGN INDark ModeHomePersonaliseLive TVIndiaWorldBusinessTechnologyShowbuzzSportsScienceHealthNews AnalysisHappiness QuestMagazineTrendingNewsMoVideosLifestyleEnvironmentEducationLaw TodayAutoCitiesCrimePodcastsOpinionHoroscopesWeatherInteractivesVisual StoriesCryptoFact CheckDIUPhotosCode of EthicsNewsNewsIndiaGalwan martyr's father thrashed, arrested for 'illegally' constructing son's memorial Bihar Police thrashes, arrests Galwan martyr's father for 'illegally' constructing son's memorial The father of a soldier who lost his life in the 2020 Galwan Valley clash was thrashed and later arrested by the police for constructing his son's memorial in Bihar's Vaishali.AdvertisementRohit Kumar SinghPatna,UPDATED: Feb 28, 2023 18:10 ISTFamily members of Jai Kishore Singh, who was martyred in the 2020 Galwan Valley clash, alleged that Singh's father was thrashed and later arrested by police (File)By Rohit Kumar Singh: The father of Jai Kishore Singh, the armyman who laid down his life fighting the Chinese troops in Galwan Valley in 2020, has been sent to jail on charges of constructing a memorial in the memory of his son 'illegally' in a village in Bihar's Vaishali district.A CCTV footage has also gone viral on social media, where the father of the victim is seen being dragged by the cops and taken to a police station in the middle of the night on Saturday. 
advertisementRaj Kapoor Singh, had constructed a memorial in memory of his son on February 24 of last year in their village, Kajri Buzurg, under the Jandaha police station in Vaishali district. Several local government officials had also participated in the function when the memorial was inaugurated.However, trouble started for the martyr's family last December when they faced objections from their neighbour, Harinath Ram, when they raised a wall around the bust. Harinath Ram alleged that Raj Kapoor Singh had violated an agreement under which he was supposed to buy a piece of land for him elsewhere as the memorial was constructed on land belonging to him, which blocked his movement to his house.Read | 3 separate brawls, 'outsider' Chinese troops & more: Most detailed account of the brutal June 15 Galwan battleRaj Kapoor Singh was arrested after a case was filed against him for violating Indian Penal Code (IPC) Sections 188, 323, 504 and 506, as well as various sections of the SC/ST Act."The police told me to remove the memorial within 15 days. After that, the local police came to the house and arrested my father and then took him away, beating and abusing him," said Nand Kishore Singh, brother of martyr Jai Kishore Singh.After the case was registered against Raj Kapoor Singh, he was forcibly arrested from his house on Saturday night."The complainant in this case said that because of the construction of the memorial, it blocked his movement to his house. Based on the complaint, the father, the martyr, has been arrested," said Poonam Kesari, DSP Mahua.Read | My grandfather was a martyr, why would I insult Army: Bihar minister clarifies ‘eunuchs’ remark--- ENDS ---

text: Jasprit Bumrah likely to miss IPL 2023 | Cricket News - Times of IndiaTop SearchesSouth Africa vs West IndiesIndia vs AustraliaLionel MessiSachin Tendulkar StatueNew Zealand vs EnglandIPL ScheduleWPL 2023 ScheduleWomen's World Cup ScheduleWomen's World Cup Points Table 2023CSK IPL 2023 SquadEditionININUSSign InTOIsportsCricketIPLCWG 2022FootballBadmintonHockeyTennisRacingAthleticsShootingVolleyballChessWWEBoxingGolfSnooker/BilliardsCyclingWrestlingothersIPL 2023scheduleteamsstatspoints tablephotosNewsSports NewsCricket NewsIPL 2023 NewsJasprit Bumrah likely to miss IPL 2023Jasprit Bumrah likely to miss IPL 2023TIMESOFINDIA.COM /  Feb 28, 2023, 18:50 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeARTICLESJasprit Bumrah likely to miss IPL 2023Bought an EV? Now protect the EV with electric vehicle InsuranceWould be great to have MS Dhoni in SA20: Aiden MarkramSunrisers Hyderabad IPL 2023 Schedule: Full league stage schedule, matches timings, venues and full squad(IPL Photo)NEW DELHI: Jasprit Bumrah's long-awaited return to cricket dealt another blow with the Indian pace spearhead all set to miss the upcoming Indian Premier League (IPL) 2023, ESPNCricinfo reported on Tuesday.Mumbai Indians pacer Bumrah, who has been out of action at the international level since September 2022, has been given the option of undergoing back surgery.There is a possibility that Bumrah could also miss the World Test Championship final (subject to India's qualification) scheduled to be played from June 7 onwards at The OvalBumrah missed the T20 World Cup, Bangladesh tour and the home series versus Sri Lanka and New Zealand. He is also not part of either the Test or the ODI team for the Australia series.The medical staff of the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) at the National Cricket Academy (NCA) in Bengaluru is treating Bumrah's case urgently and suggested him to undergo surgery after facing recurring niggles in his lower back which surfaced originally in the form of stress reaction last August.A final decision on the next step is expected to be taken soon by BCCI in coordination with the NCA and Bumrah, keeping in mind the ICC Cricket World Cup, which is set to take place in India from October-November this year.It has been a frustrating wait for Bumrah, who has attempted to make a comeback more than once since suffering a back injury in August which ruled him out of the Asia Cup. Initially, the injury did not seem serious as he was named in India's T20 World Cup squad in September and even played the last two T20Is against Australia on September 23 and 25.Three days later, Bumrah did not play the first T20I against South Africa and it was learnt that he was taken for scans, which revealed a stress-related injury in his back. He was rushed to NCA and the scans there confirmed that the injury was serious. It ruled him out of the T20 World Cup, in which India achieved a semifinal finish.Bumrah resumed his rehab in November and started to bowl in mid-December. His progress seemed to be positive as he was added in the white-ball series played in January more than a week after the original squad was picked up.Bumrah had performed the match simulation exercises in the NCA, but discomfort resurfaced while taking up higher workloads during fitness drills in January. Scans revealed the development of a fresh niggle, which ruled him out of the Sri Lanka series and Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia.Indian team management and skipper Rohit Sharma want Bumrah to return back to the side only after gaining full fitness, with Rohit warning against rushing the pacer back into the team.(With ANI Inputs)Start a ConversationFOLLOW US ON SOCIAL text:
Liquor Scam: Manish Sisodia Resigns As Delhi Deputy CM, Satyendar Jain Too Quits As Health Minister | India News | Zee Newsहिन्दीEnglishमराठीবাংলাதமிழ்മലയാളംગુજરાતીతెలుగుಕನ್ನಡBusinessTechWorldHealthNEWSVIDEOSPHOTOSWeb StoriesLogoutSign InLogoutGOHomeLive TVWomen Achievers AwardsLatest NewsIndiaAhmedabadBengaluruChennaiHyderabadKolkataMumbaiPuneMY MONEYCricketEntertainmentHollywoodMusicBollywoodTelevisionRegionalMovie ReviewSportsFootballTennisBadmintonOther SportsLifestyleRelationshipTravelFood & RecipesFashionCultureSpiritualityBusinessEconomyMarketsCompaniesReal EstateInternational BusinessPersonal FinanceAutomobileWorldAsiaAfricaAmericasAustralia-OceaniaEuropeMobilityViral newsDiabytesTechnologyGadgetGamingInternet & Social MediaAppsMobileLive TVWomen Achievers AwardsLatest NewsIndiaMY MONEYCricketEntertainmentSportsLifestyleBusinessWorldMobilityViral newsDiabytesHomeLive TVWomen Achievers AwardsLatest NewsIndiaMY MONEYCricketEntertainmentSportsLifestyleBusinessWorldMobilityViral newsDiabytesTechnologyXtopStoriesenglish2578080NewsIndiaMANISH SISODIA QUITSLiquor Scam: Manish Sisodia Resigns As Delhi Deputy CM, Satyendar Jain Too Quits As Health MinisterAlong with Manish Sisodia, Health Minister Satyendar Jain has also quit from his post. Jain is lodged in jail in a separate corruption case. The resignations have been accepted by Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal.
Written By  Zee Media Bureau|Last Updated: Feb 28, 2023, 06:29 PM IST|Source: Bureau ×Trending Photos7Shardul ThakurShardul Thakur, Mittali Parulkar's Wedding: India All-Rounder Shares BEAUTIFUL Photos From Dreamy Wedding - Check6EntertainmentJackky Bhagnani Hosts Party For Singer CKay; Rumoured Couple Ananya Panday-Aditya Roy Kapur Attend: In Pics 6SportsLionel Messi Wins FIFA Award For 7th Time: Check TOP Achievements, in PICS12EntertainmentHoroscope Today, February 28 by Astro Sundeep Kochar: Stop Being Jealous, AquariusIn a big development, senior Aam Aadmi Party leader Manish Sisodia has resigned as Deputy Chief Minister of Delhi amid the allegations of corruption in the ongoing Liquor Scam Case. Along with Sisodia, Health Minister Satyendar Jain has also quit from his post. Jain is lodged in jail in a separate corruption case. The resignations have been accepted by Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal.

 Their resignations will now be sent to Delhi LG VK Saxena. The development comes two days after Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Sisodia was arrested by the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) in connection with the Delhi excise policy case. Sisodia was arrested on Sunday in an ongoing investigation of a case related to alleged irregularities in the framing and implementation of the excise policy of the Delhi government. Supreme Court on Tuesday refused to entertain Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia`s plea challenging his arrest in connection with the excise policy case.

The apex court suggested Sisodia to move to Delhi High Court.
A bench headed by Chief Justice of India DY Chandrachud said that the court is not inclined to entertain the petition at this stage and suggested Sisodia to move to Delhi High Court. "It can not interfere in the matter as it may open the gate of people approaching the top court in every such matter," the court remarked.

Delhi`s Rouse Avenue Court on Monday sent him to CBI custody for 5 days. The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has quizzed Delhi`s Minister Satyendar Jain in Tihar Jail in connection with alleged corruption in the implementation of the Delhi Excise Policy.Jain is presently lodged in Judicial Custody in connection with another case related to money laundering case registered by the Enforcement Directorate (ED).His name surfaced in the matter along with another cabinet Minister of Delhi as well as Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal.

text:
New Zealand vs England: Ben Stokes confirms he will play IPL 2023 for CSK despite knee injury scare - India Today India TodayDailyOIndiaTodayNEMalayalamBusiness TodayAaj TakLallantopBanglaGNTTViChowkReader’s DigestSports TakCrime TakAstro TakGamingHarper's BazaarBrides TodayCosmopolitanIshq FMAaj Tak CampusKisan TakMagazineLIVELive TVSearchSEARCHTRENDING TOPICSSIGN INDark ModeHomePersonaliseLive TVIndiaWorldBusinessTechnologyShowbuzzSportsScienceHealthNews AnalysisHappiness QuestMagazineTrendingNewsMoVideosLifestyleEnvironmentEducationLaw TodayAutoCitiesCrimePodcastsOpinionHoroscopesWeatherInteractivesVisual StoriesCryptoFact CheckDIUPhotosCode of EthicsNewsNewsSportsCricketBen Stokes confirms he will play IPL 2023 for CSK despite knee injury New Zealand vs England: Ben Stokes confirms he will play IPL 2023 for CSK despite knee injury scareNew Zealand vs England, 2nd Test: Captain Ben Stokes conceded that the knee injury has been bogging him down but maintained that he would head to India to play the Indian Premier League with Chennai Super Kings. AdvertisementIndia Today Sports DeskNew Delhi,UPDATED: Feb 28, 2023 17:31 ISTBen Stokes confirmed he will play in IPL 2023 (AP Photo)In ShortBen Stokes was bought by CSK for a whopping sum of Rs 16.25 croreStokes was managing a knee injury during the Test series vs New ZealandEngland lost the 2nd Test by the barest of margins in Wellington on MondayBy India Today Sports Desk: England captain Ben Stokes confirmed on Monday, February 28 that he will definitely confirm his Indian Premier League (IPL) 2023 commitments for Chennai Super Kings despite his knee injury concern. Stokes was struggling with the knee injury during the 2-Test series against New Zealand in New Zealand which ended in a 1-1 draw on Monday. advertisementBen Stokes bowled only 2 overs in the 2nd Test which ended in a thrilling 1-run win for New Zealand, who fought back after being asked to follow after they were bundled out for 209. Stokes was in visible discomfort as he was going through pain in his knee when batting in the 2nd Test. Stokes hit 27 in the first innings and hit 33 after managing to stay for 116 balls in the 2nd innings but it was not enough for England who agonisingly lost by 1 run. Stokes had hinted earlier this month that he would probably miss the business end of IPL 2023 to prepare for the one-off Test against Ireland, which gets underway from June 1. The Ashes gets underway from June 16 and Stokes said being fit and completing his duty as an all-rounder is his priority. IPL 2023 will get underway from March 31 and the final will be played on May 28 and Stokes said he has been discussing his workload management plan with Chennai Super Kings head coach Stephen Fleming. Stokes, who missed the IPL 2022 season and suffered an injury in 2021, was bought by Chennai Super Kings for Rs 16.25 crore. "I am going to the IPL. I have had conversations with ‘Flem’ and he’s fully aware of the situation with my body. It’s a week by week case at the moment," Stokes said after the 2nd Test in Wellington. 'NOT GOING TO LIE'Stokes has been sensational as England's Test captain, winning 10 of his 13 Tests. He and head coach Brendon McCullum have changed the face of England cricket, playing an aggressive brand that is referred to as the Bazball. Stokes, however, highlighted the importance of the Ashes, saying he is hoping to be full fit to lead from the front while conceding that the injury concern has been holding him back. "I am not going to lie, it’s incredibly frustrating knowing something has been holding me back from performing as I’d like to. I have been working hard with the physios and the medics trying to get myself to a place where I can fulfil my role as I have done for the last 10 year," he added. ‘I’ve got a four-month period now to get it better before the Ashes because I want to be turning up for the first Test in Birmingham able to fulfil my role properly. I’ll be doing everything I can to give myself the best opportunity not to have to worry about it.’--- ENDS ---Also Read |  India vs Australia: KL Rahul's removal as vice-captain doesn't indicate anything, says Rohit Sharma

text: Karnataka assembly elections: Congress plans stiff fight against BJP heavyweights | Bengaluru News - Times of IndiaTop SearchesDelhi Excise Policy CaseMeghalaya EarthquakeMumbai Train AccidentManish Sisodia NewsLeh Ice Wall ClimbingBihar Budget 2023 LiveB S YediyurrappaEditionININUSSign  regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnapuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotospoliticscivic issuescrimeschool and collegeskarnataka electionscitizen reportervideosphotosweatherpollution newseventsKarnataka electionsNewsCity Newsbengaluru NewsKarnataka assembly elections: Congress plans stiff fight against BJP heavyweightsKarnataka assembly elections: Congress plans stiff fight against BJP heavyweightsAnil Gejji / TNN /  Feb 28, 2023, 09:03 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeARTICLESKarnataka assembly elections: Congress plans stiff fight against BJP heavyweightsBought an EV? Now protect the EV with electric vehicle InsuranceSaudis put it across IndiaBengaluru United, ASC advance to semisThe main opposition party is still in the process of selecting candidates and names are yet to be finalised, a senior functionary suggested Kulkarni’s candidature from Shiggaon would be idealBENGALURU: The Congress party appears to be changing tack on selection of candidates for key constituencies, including Shiggaon, currently represented by chief minister Basavaraj Bommai, as they plan to give BJP heavyweights a run for their money.In Shiggaon for example, Congress is planning to field former minister Vinay Kulkarni instead of Sayeed Azeempeer Khadri in a bid to take advantage of ‘perceived’ angst of Panchamasali Lingayats against Bommai and the current dispensation over the reservation issue.While the main opposition party is still in the process of selecting candidates and names are yet to be finalised, a senior functionary suggested Kulkarni’s candidature from Shiggaon would be ideal.“Vinay’s candidature will help us cash in on the anger of the Panchamasali community against the BJP government and especially against Bommai over the delay in providing reservation for the community under 2A category,” said the functionary.But sources say Vinay is undecided as he is keen on winning Dharwad Rural seat, which he represented thrice before losing to BJP in 2018. He is also weighing the option of fielding his wife from Dharwad Rural if the party insists he contest from Shiggaon.Khadri has been unsuccessfully against Bommai since 2004. Congress had named him in previous elections with an eye on Muslim votes, the second biggest chunk after Panchamasalis. If Vinay refuses to contest from Shiggaon, the party is planning to field former Byadagi MLA Basavaraj Shivannavar, a Kuruba.In Dharwad West, represented by Aravind Bellad, who was in the running to replace BS Yediyurappa as chief minister, Congress is mullin g nominating Santosh Lad. The move is being planned with an eye on consolidating the considerable Maratha community vote. Congress’ SR More, a Maratha, had won the seat four times before BJP wrested it two decades ago.However, Lad is said to be keen on contesting from Kalaghatagi, which he represented twice, before losing in 2018. A tussle between KPCC president DK Shivakumar and opposition leader Siddaramaiah over the candidate for Kalaghatagi is also behind the idea. While Siddaramaiah is keen on fielding Lad from Kalaghatagi, Shivakumar is said to be backing Nagaraj Chabbi. As a consensus, the party is likely to field one of them from Dharwad West.The party is also in talks with BJP MLC Puttanna whom they are hoping to field from Rajajinagar (Bengaluru), currently represented by BJP’s S Suresh Kumar.In Chikkamagaluru, the party is looking for a Lingayat candidate to take on incumbent and BJP national general secretary CT Ravi. Sources say the party may field BH Harish, who contested from JD(S) and polled 38,000 votes in 2018, or HD Thammaiah, an aide of Ravi. Delhi Liquor Scam: SC Refuses To Hear Manish Sisodia's Bail Plea, AAP To Move HC Now | India News | Zee Newsहिन्दीEnglishमराठीবাংলাதமிழ்മലയാളംગુજરાતીతెలుగుಕನ್ನಡBusinessTechWorldHealthNEWSVIDEOSPHOTOSWeb StoriesLogoutSign InLogoutGOHomeLive TVWomen Achievers AwardsLatest NewsIndiaAhmedabadBengaluruChennaiHyderabadKolkataMumbaiPuneMY MONEYCricketEntertainmentHollywoodMusicBollywoodTelevisionRegionalMovie ReviewSportsFootballTennisBadmintonOther SportsLifestyleRelationshipTravelFood & RecipesFashionCultureSpiritualityBusinessEconomyMarketsCompaniesReal EstateInternational BusinessPersonal FinanceAutomobileWorldAsiaAfricaAmericasAustralia-OceaniaEuropeMobilityViral newsDiabytesTechnologyGadgetGamingInternet & Social MediaAppsMobileLive TVWomen Achievers AwardsLatest NewsIndiaMY MONEYCricketEntertainmentSportsLifestyleBusinessWorldMobilityViral newsDiabytesHomeLive TVWomen Achievers AwardsLatest NewsIndiaMY MONEYCricketEntertainmentSportsLifestyleBusinessWorldMobilityViral newsDiabytesTechnologyXtopStoriesenglish2578073NewsIndiaDELHI LIQUOR SCAMDelhi Liquor Scam: SC Refuses To Hear Manish Sisodia's Bail Plea, AAP To Move HC NowA bench comprising Chief Justice D Y Chandrachud and Justice P S Narasimha has refused to intervene in Manish Sisodia’s case.
Edited By:  Zee Media Bureau|Last Updated: Feb 28, 2023, 05:48 PM IST|Source: Bureau ×Trending Photos7Shardul ThakurShardul Thakur, Mittali Parulkar's Wedding: India All-Rounder Shares BEAUTIFUL Photos From Dreamy Wedding - Check6EntertainmentJackky Bhagnani Hosts Party For Singer CKay; Rumoured Couple Ananya Panday-Aditya Roy Kapur Attend: In Pics 6SportsLionel Messi Wins FIFA Award For 7th Time: Check TOP Achievements, in PICS12EntertainmentHoroscope Today, February 28 by Astro Sundeep Kochar: Stop Being Jealous, AquariusNew Delhi: The Supreme Court on Tuesday declined to hear the bail plea of Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia, who is in CBI custody, in connection with the excise policy case, news agency PTI reported. The Aam Aadmi Party will now move to Delhi HC over Sisodia's arrest, news agency ANI reported. A bench comprising Chief Justice D Y Chandrachud and Justice P S Narasimha has refused to intervene in Sisodia’s case, and asked him to 'avail alternative remedies'. The Delhi Deputy Chief Minister approached SC on Tuesday for bail in the excise policy case. The top court observed that the arrested AAP leader has remedies under the Code of Criminal Procedure (CrPC) to move the Delhi High Court for bail and seek the quashing of the FIR. A special Delhi court on Monday sent Sisodia to five-day CBI remand in the excise policy case to allow the agency to get "genuine and legitimate" answers to questions being put to him for "a proper and fair

Special CBI judge M K Nagpal, on Monday, allowed the plea of CBI seeking custodial interrogation of Sisodia for five days in the excise scam case.

Also Read: 'First Time An Education Minister Will Go To Tihar Jail': Gambhir Slams Sisodia
The trial judge said though the accused had joined the investigation of this case on two earlier occasions, it has also been observed that he has failed to provide satisfactory answers to most of the questions put to him during his examination and interrogation. Thus, he has failed to legitimately explain the incriminating evidence which has allegedly surfaced against him during the investigation conducted so far.


AAP to go to Delhi HC pertaining to Delhi Dy CM Manish Sisodia's arrest by CBI: AAP

Earlier, SC refused to entertain Delhi Dy CM Manish Sisodia's plea against his arrest by CBI & suggested him to move High Court. https://t.co/IyRQtI7bnM
— ANI (@ANI) February 28, 2023

It is true that he cannot be expected to make self-incriminating statements, but the interests of justice and of a fair investigation require him to come up with some legitimate answers to the questions which are being put to him by the investigating officer (IO), the trial judge had said.

The CBI on Sunday evening arrested Sisodia in connection with alleged corruption in the formulation and implementation of the now-scrapped liquor policy for 2021-22.

Earlier this month, the agency had interrogated Delhi minister Satyendar Jain in Tihar Jail in connection with the case after taking permission from the judge.

Jain was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate in a money laundering case. He is not an accused in the excise policy case.
The CBI had also quizzed AAP's communication in-charge Vijay Nair, who is also lodged in Tihar Jail, in connection with the excise policy money laundering case being probed by the ED.

Nair was earlier granted bail in the CBI excise policy case by the court.Live Tvdelhi liquor scamDelhi Excise ScamManish SisodiaSupreme CourtAam Aadmi PartyMore Stories Manish Sisodia Quits Sisodia Resigns As Delhi Deputy CM, Satyendar Jain Too Quits As Minister Bill Gates Bill Gates Visits RBI HQ In Mumbai; Meets Governor ShaktiKanta Das  Gurugram Men Riding Luxury Car Allegedly Steal Flower Pots From G20 Event in Gurugram snap Snap Joins AI Race; Announces To Integrate OpenAI's ChatGPT With Platform manish sisodia arrest Delhi Excise Policy Case: Manish Sisodia Resigns As Deputy Delhi CM India vs Australia 2023 LIVE Updates | IND VS AUS 3rd Test, Day 1 Cricket Match Live Score Ben stokes I’m Not Going To Lie...: Ben Stokes Opens Up On His Availability For CSK KL Rahul Rohit Sharma REVEALS Real Reason Behind Removing KL Rahul As Vice CaptainComments - Join the DiscussionTrending newsDNA VideoDNA: Famous writer Anant Pai passed away on this day in the year 2011DNA VideoDNA: For the first time in the year 1886, Aluminum was made in the laboratoryDNA VideoDNA: When India's first education minister Abul Kalam Azad died in 1958DNA VideoDNA: When will the Russia-Ukraine war end?DNA VideoDNA: Fear of corona infection, Home becomes 'Jail'

text:
Amritpal Singh Sandhu: Punjab in panthic ferment - India Today India TodayDailyOIndiaTodayNEMalayalamBusiness TodayAaj TakLallantopBanglaGNTTViChowkReader’s DigestSports TakCrime TakAstro TakGamingHarper's BazaarBrides TodayCosmopolitanIshq FMAaj Tak CampusKisan TakMagazineLIVELive TVSearchSEARCHTRENDING TOPICSSIGN INDark ModeHomePersonaliseLive TVIndiaWorldBusinessTechnologyShowbuzzSportsScienceHealthNews AnalysisHappiness QuestMagazineTrendingNewsMoVideosLifestyleEnvironmentEducationLaw TodayAutoCitiesCrimePodcastsOpinionHoroscopesWeatherInteractivesVisual StoriesCryptoFact CheckDIUPhotosCode of EthicsNewsNewsIndia Today InsightAmritpal Singh Sandhu: Punjab in panthic fermentSave 41% with an annual subscription of India Today Magazine  SUBSCRIBE Amritpal Singh Sandhu: Punjab in panthic fermentNew panthic leaders, some with a radical bent reminiscent of the Khalistan days, are filling the space that political parties have vacated, striving to find their own solutions to perceived crisesAdvertisementAnilesh S. MahajanNew Delhi,UPDATED: Feb 28, 2023 18:27 ISTAmritpal Singh Sandhu, self-styled ‘Bhindranwale 2.0’, has positioned himself as a new fulcrum for the panthic cause; (Photo: Bandeep Singh)(NOTE: This is a reprint of an article that was published in the INDIA TODAY edition dated February 20, 2023)On the outskirts of Amritsar, a 10-minute ride off NH-3, lies Jallupur Khera. Till a year ago, it was just another quiet hamlet on the Majha continuum, typical of the soil-born prosperity of this northwestern frontier belt of Punjab. Soothing acres of flat greens, swanky SUVs parked in palatial bungalows, cheek by jowl with big tractors. Not the hub of any activity larger than farming, except on Sangrand—or Sankranti—when Sandhu Jat Sikhs in the vicinity come visiting to pay obeisance at the gurdwara on the premises of the dera of their medieval-age patron saint, Baba Kala Mehar. That changed in the middle of August last year, when Jallupur Khera registered on Punjab’s consciousness in a way that reawakened memories of a dark, stormy past. The man responsible for it: a 30-year-old Dubai-returned Sikh radical, Amritpal Singh Sandhu. advertisementAfter a decade handling his family’s transport business in the emirate, Amritpal returned to take charge of Waris Punjab De (Heirs of Punjab), a Sikh socio-religious group formed by actor-turned-activist Deep Sidhu, who died in February 2022 in a mysterious car accident. Turbanless and with a stylish Van Dyke beard, Amritpal looked like any other chic Punjabi youngster in Dubai. That image underwent a stark revision in public, when he took the baptismal amrit and had his dastarbandi (ceremonial turban-tying) at the end of last September. More striking was the venue: Rode in Moga district, ancestral village of slain terrorist and radical icon Jarnail Singh Bhindranwale. Also of his nephew Lakhbir Singh Rode, chief of the Khalistan Zindabad Force, or KZF. After a two-decade lull beginning mid-’90s, as a fatigued, battle-scarred Punjab sutured itself back to normalcy, those names had receded into a subconscious no one wished to reopen. Khalistan, as an idea and political fantasy, was more or less relegated to the past tense by Sikhs in India—a prime minister from the community serving for a decade from 2004-14 did no harm to that mental movement. But it didn’t go entirely extinct. Of late, that currency has been regaining some emotional value for a variety of reasons, as the panthic sector in Punjab politics responds to perceived crises with a nervous regression. Does the arrival of Amritpal—as a self-styled ‘Bhindranwale 2.0’—inaugurate a new chapter of that troubling story? When INDIA TODAY met him in January, he was ensconced in the 8x8 weatherproof tent he’d set up at a ground adjacent to the Jallupur Khera gurdwara, sitting on an electrically heated floor, swathed in blankets, to ward off the northern chill. In the backdrop: a life-size portrait of Guru Gobind Singh...and a photo of Bhindranwale. Currently on a Khalsa vaheer (march to spread Sikhism), Amritpal’s antics have disinterred the buried ghosts of Khalistan. His speeches mix talk of a “silent genocide” of Sikhs with homilies on a return to piety to end all suffering, such as drug addiction. It’s not spiritualism of a quietist vein. He’s not above asking youth to take up arms in defence of the faith—and that has consequences. In November, one Sandeep Singh, alias Sunny, picked up his licensed .32-bore gun and shot down the self-styled radical Hindu leader Sudhir Suri in broad daylight in Amritsar. Sunny admitted to being influenced by Amritpal, though police could not establish any direct link. The Bhagwant Mann regime, in fact, issued a diktat in mid-November banning the public display of weapons. But Amritpal openly advocates brandishing arms. advertisementIf Amritpal has developed a cohort of radical Sikh youth, following his words keenly in Punjab’s dust-caked plains and in online spaces, it is because of the churn that has beset panthic politics—where religious fervour often strays from orthodoxy to radicalism. The old vanguard of panthic politics— the Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD)—is in steep decline, after over a century of panthic voices dominating Sikh religious as well as political discourse. None of the lesser Akali factions is strong enough to replace the Badal-controlled SAD. Party chief Sukhbir Badal’s father Parkash Badal had rebuilt the Akali Dal in 1995, bringing the fragmented leadership together. After the SAD’s famous Moga convention, Badal Sr pretty much captured the panthic space—most hardliners like Simranjit Mann or Gurcharan Tohra were marginalised. From those commanding heights, the roots of the present decline were sown as the SAD declared itself a secular, pan-Punjab party, allied with the BJP and even fielded Hindu candidates for assembly polls. In 2019, the Badals presided over an even steeper fall with their stance on Article 370 and the Citizenship Amendment Act, going against the grain of federalism that has always marked Sikh politics. And even if it broke with the BJP on the farm laws, the long association cost it dearly and added to its image of being far removed from its panthic Jat Sikh base. The accusations of outright mismanagement during the 2015 incidents of sacrilege of Sikh scriptures, when it was in power, crowned that sense of apathy. advertisementLast year’s polls put only three SAD faces in the assembly, none with a panthic background. The party, whose vote share usually ranges between the mid-30s and mid-40s, managed only 18-odd per cent. In the subsequent bypoll for the Sangrur Lok Sabha seat, it was the old radical Simranjit Singh Mann who won; the Badal faction attempted to win back radical sympathies by fielding Kamaldeep Kaur Rajoana, the sister of Balwant Rajoana, who was convicted in the Beant Singh assassination, but she came a poor fifth. FILLING A VACUUMAs former parliamentarian Tarlochan Singh puts it, Punjab feels the lack of a genuine Sikh leader—social, religious or political—profoundly. He also points to other absences, asking why the apex court, the armed forces brass or top bureaucracy lack Sikh faces. It is in this vacuum that the new panthic faces are finding a following. Most analyses of the dramatic rise of AAP ascribe it to the feelings of anger against the established bodies, primarily the Sikh ones, that were perceived to have fallen into lethargy. Now Mann’s regime is also being accused, even by its own MLAs, of not following up on the 2015 incidents or the subsequent police firing that killed two protesters at Behbal Kalan near Kotkapura, in Faridkot district. As Amritpal says: “Even after seven years, there is no justice.” Official inaction means the radicals may be arrogating to themselves the role of judge, jury and executioner. On November 10, Pradeep Singh, an accused in the sacrilege cases, was gunned down in Kotkapura. Canada-based gangster Goldy Brar, also accused of orchestrating the murder of singer-turned-politician Sidhu Moosewala, claimed responsibility. The cops nabbed the shooters, but have not established a motive or link. advertisementIn retrospect, the whole trail seems marked by omissions and evasions. The Behbal Kalan Insaaf Morcha, which has been on a sit-in protest for over 400 days now, has demanded the resignation of Vidhan Sabha Speaker Kultar Singh Sandhwan, the local MLA from Kotkapura who in the past was among the protesters. The Mann regime has been wary, almost inviting comparisons with the scenario painted earlier by AAP MLA and former IGP Kunwar Vijay Pratap Singh, who had alleged the two previous SIT investigations into the October 2015 police firing were aimed more at shielding politicians than nailing the culprits. “Two years ago, the Punjab and Haryana High Court had quashed my investigation into the Kotkapura incident. The Congress and Mann governments have also not pursued the case,” he says. Even on inter-state issues, the Mann regime, after initial goof-ups, is perceived to be toeing the established line. Panthic voters are very sensitive on the issue of Chandigarh and feel strongly about Punjab—a Sikh-majority state—not having a capital of its own after losing its original capital, Lahore, to Pakistan. The overriding sentiment is that Chandigarh was built to compensate for this loss. Equally close to panthic hearts is the question of letting Punjab waters flow into the SYL canal. Radicals like Simranjit Mann or newbies like Amritpal keep stoking these sentiments. The AAP government is moving cautiously. In June last year, it allowed a Dal Khalsa protest march against Operation Blue Star and in support of the slain Bhindranwale. AAP leaders in Punjab say they believe in freedom of speech for everyone, but insist that violence will not be allowed. “Anyone indulging in violence has been booked and arrested,” says AAP Punjab spokesperson Malwinder Kang. The party does have legislators from a panthic background, like Kultar Sandhwan, Gurmeet Singh Khuddian and Jaswinder Singh Ramdas. But unlike his predecessors Capt. Amarinder Singh and Badal, Mann, who comes from a Left background, has shown little interest in panthic politics. Caution, however, is not helping the AAP regime escape the crossfire, like when the panthics demand the release of Sikh militants who remain lodged in Punjab and Delhi jails for decades now. “If India can release Rajiv Gandhi’s killers, or the Bilkis Bano rape accused, why can’t they release the Sikh prisoners?” asks Simranjit Mann. The list of ‘Bandi Singhs’, as they are called, has several names associated with the terrorism of the ‘80s-90s, including Rajoana. The father of his co-conspirator Jagtar Singh Hawara, Gurcharan Singh Hawara, floated the Qaumi Insaf Morcha, and has taken his protest to the Mohali-Chandigarh highway to seek the release of Jagtar and 21 others. Hawara Jr was anointed a parallel jathedar of the Akal Takht in November 2016. Although the SGPC is backing the protest, chief Harjinder Singh Dhami was roughed up on January 18 when he visited the protest site. It’s a nightmare situation for the security agencies; if Hawara Jr is ever released, the radicals will move to make him the next Akal Takht jathedar, which may spread radicalisation further. The SGPC has set up an 11-member panel with leaders from all panthic factions to push for their release. The Badals, post their exit from the NDA, were also pushing to be part of the campaign, but several Sikh preachers, among them Baljit Singh Daduwal who wields influence in both Punjab and Haryana, saw it as a plank by a desperate Sukhbir to revive his fortunes. WHO’LL PLAY BOSS?These days, panthic ire is also trained on the government in neighbouring Haryana. In December, the M.L. Khattar regime there constituted an ad hoc 38-member Haryana Sikh Gurdwara Management Committee (HSGMC)—pursuant to the apex court ratifying, in September, the constitutional validity of a 2014 legislation passed by the then Congress regime. Panthic Sikhs see it as a move to divide Sikhs further. As it is, the SGPC has control only in Punjab, Himachal, J&K and Chandigarh now. The pain was reflected in Akal Takht jathedar Giani Harpreet Singh’s Facebook post where he said the apex court verdict was akin to a second “geographical murder of SGPC” (the 1947 loss of turf being the first). A line that followed was more inflammatory: “I wish! Sikh sentiments should be respected even for an independent political system.” The pointed allusion was not lost on anyone.In a conversation with INDIA TODAY, Khattar said separate management of gurdwaras was not going to affect the unity of the faith. But the swiftness with which his regime moved has sparked a war with SGPC president Dhami and the Akal Takht jathedar. Dhami told INDIA TODAY that the BJP-RSS is interfering in Sikh religious affairs and the HSGMC was part of this. Even those among the Sikh clergy who back Khattar’s move criticise the appointment of Mahant Karamjit Singh, chief of the Yamunanagar-based Sewapanthi sect, as the chief of the new body. Panthic leaders do not consider the Sewapanthi as part of the fold, nor do they accept a mahant as the chief of a gurdwara management body. Daduwal, who’s a former president of HSGMC, tells INDIA TODAY, “No Sikh can accept anyone other than the Guru Granth Sahib as the patron of any Sikh body.” The issue has handed panthic leaders and radicals a surcharged issue to play with—freeing gurdwaras from “government control”. Even moderate Sikhs are seeking an All India Sikh Gurdwara Act to have a reunited SGPC. THE KHALISTAN SPECTREPanthic leaders, however, walk the razor’s edge as their demands are often misunderstood to be in aid of the Khalistan cause. “Extremism appears romantic, but isn’t,” says Chanan Singh, a rehabilitated extremist. “We have gone through the struggle and know that no parents want their sons killed.” Which is why Amritpal’s antics have put him in confrontation with other panthic groups. Things flared up on December 9 when Amritpal’s supporters broke furniture at a gurdwara in Kapurthala’s Biharipur village. Days later, they repeated the act at a gurdwara in Jalandhar’s Model Town. Amritpal justified the vandalism, saying seating arrangements at the same level as the Guru Granth Sahib were sacrilegious. But all signs are that these incidents have lessened his pull. For, a lot of water has flowed down the Sutlej since the cordite-choked ‘80s-90s. The demand for a separate homeland resonates only among a section of the Jat Sikhs, and it’s tied up with their self-image of social dominance. Khalistan has no appeal among the Hindu population or to the vast OBC and Dalit segment across religions. The former makes up 32 per cent of Punjab’s population. And cumulatively, the lesser endowed castes total about 65 per cent. OBC and Dalit Sikhs derive their spiritual sustenance and protective cover from the deras and other outfits that have sprung up in the past four decades. It’s these that panthic outfits are waging war on—be it Amritpal against the Christian pastors working among Dalit Sikhs, or Dera Sacha Sauda’s continuous confrontation with canonical Sikhism. That’s why Subhash Chander Singh, chief of the Radha Soami Dera Teja Singh at Amritsar, says: “There are no takers for Khalistan, some people are just using it for their own benefit. The real issues Punjab and Sikhism face are drugs, pollution of soil, air and water, and livelihood.” Former Punjab DGP Shashi Kant too sees the radical element as outsiders. “These fringe elements keep making noise in the US, UK and Canada,” he says. Prime Minister Narendra Modi, meanwhile, has kept up his outreach to the Sikhs. On December 26, he marked the first Veer Bal Diwas to commemorate the sacrifice of Guru Gobind Singh’s sons. Then, Darshan Dhaliwal, a US-based businessman deported in 2020-21 when he came to organize a langar during the farm agitation, was conferred the Pravasi Bharatiya Samman. For the state and the Centre, there are strategic considerations to consider, with pro-Khalistan militants seemingly lurking in the shadows. Somehow, events have kept that pot simmering: take the recent mystery deaths of terrorists Harvinder Singh Sandhu, alias Rinda, and Harpreet Singh, alias Happy Sanghera, in Pakistan and Italy respectively, and the arrest of Kulwinderjit Singh, alias Khanpuria, from Delhi airport in November. There are those like Sikh intellectual G.B.S. Sidhu who believe this churn can throw up something good for the future. It’s the present the government has to safeguard.Subscribe to India Today Magazine--- ENDS ---

text:
These Railway Officers To Spend First 10 Years In Field: Railway Board
NDTVहिंदी न्यूज़BUSINESSMOVIESCRICKETTECHFOODLIFESTYLEHEALTHAUTOCROSSWORDBig BonusSWASTHSHOPPINGLIVE TV LATEST INDIA Elections VIDEO OPINION CITIES WORLD Education OFFBEAT TRENDS FeatureSOUTHPEOPLESciencePhotosWEATHERTV ScheduleTrainsThese Railway Officers To Spend First 10 Years In Field: Railway BoardSearch
            ​				                HomeIndia NewsThese Railway Officers To Spend First 10 Years In Field: Railway Board These Railway Officers To Spend First 10 Years In Field: Railway Board  "Field postings are strenuous and demanding and are more productive for railways," officials said. India NewsPress Trust of IndiaUpdated: February 28, 2023 7:50 pm ISTGroup-A officers of Railways run the entire machinery, right from train running to policy formation.New Delhi: In a major policy change, young officers of the Indian Railways will now have to spend the first 10 years of their service in the field before being eligible to be posted at the headquarters, the Railway Board has said.Currently, even new officers could be posted at the headquarters.Sources said the decision has been taken to ensure that officers have enough experience at the field level before making their way to cushy posts in the HQ."In order to ensure adequate exposure of field working to Direct Recruit Group 'A Railway officers, it has been decided that for the initial 10 years of their service, directly recruited Group 'A' Railway Officers shall normally be posted in field and shall not be posted in the headquarters," the order issued by the Railway Board said.Notably, addressing a meeting after a derailment in Andhra Pradesh recently, Railway Board Chairman A K Lahoti had asked general managers and divisional railway managers from across India to go to the accident sites themselves and seek solutions."Field postings are strenuous and demanding and are more productive for railways. It also readies young officers for challenges that they might encounter and help in their decision-making," the officials said explaining the idea behind the decision.Another officer said it has been felt that decision-makers in the national transporter have increasingly become detached from realities on the ground."Initial postings on the field will make them equipped with ground realities. Also, they will learn how to live in rural areas where often even the basic amenities are missing,' he said.The Railway Board order issued on February 21 also stated that an officer could be posted in the headquarters (HQ) only in case of exceptional compelling reasons with the approval of the general manager concerned.PromotedListen to the latest songs, only on JioSaavn.comThe group-A officers of Railways run the entire machinery, right from train running to policy formulation to technical aspects to revenue collections. These officers are recruited through the highest recruitment body - Union Public Service Commission.(Except for the headline, this story has not been edited by NDTV staff and is published from a syndicated feed.)Featured Video Of The DaySky Full Of Stars: Akshay Kumar, Disha Patani, Mouni Roy And Sonam Bajwa Spotted At AirportTrack Latest News Live on NDTV.com and get news updates from India  and around the world. I have received so much love in both my concerts and now getting an opportunity to interact with everyone on Amazon and sharing about Kpop trends was definitely an experience to remember.
Last Updated: Feb 28, 2023, 04:46 PM IST|Source:  ×Trending Photos7Shardul ThakurShardul Thakur, Mittali Parulkar's Wedding: India All-Rounder Shares BEAUTIFUL Photos From Dreamy Wedding - Check6EntertainmentJackky Bhagnani Hosts Party For Singer CKay; Rumoured Couple Ananya Panday-Aditya Roy Kapur Attend: In Pics 6SportsLionel Messi Wins FIFA Award For 7th Time: Check TOP Achievements, in PICS12EntertainmentHoroscope Today, February 28 by Astro Sundeep Kochar: Stop Being Jealous, AquariusFrom Kpop culture to Kpop fashion to Kpop music everything is making global waves . India currently is amongst top 10 Kpop content consumers. Youngsters are completely mesmerised by this Korean wave.

It was not a surprise  that netizens went crazy to watch there favourite actress Nitanshi goel also known as Kpop princess with Korean singer Aoora ( who recently visited india for Kpop concerts in Mumbai and Jammu ) on a popular shopping platform Amazon . They both came live on Amazon to share tips on Kpop trends . There interaction in Korean  and Hindi won many hearts. We look forward to many such interactions and collaborations where Indo Korean celebrities can come together and share more about such cultural exchanges .

Nitanshi Goel was extremely excited with the response and mentioned-

There is a lot of exchange happening between India and Korea in terms of content consumption. We love their K-dramas and K-Pop and they also love our cinema and our culture.

My huge fan following in India and Korea is in fact, a major reason why I loves to style myself in both the looks. K-pop idols always share their appreciation towards their fans and find ways to interact with fans who’ve been supporting them since the beginning. It was great to meet K-POP singer Aoora through Amazon live. I am sure all my fans also loved him as much as I did .
Kpop singer Aoora mentioned - my first India visit has been very memorable for me . I have received so much love in both my concerts and now getting an opportunity to interact with everyone on Amazon and sharing about Kpop trends was definitely an experience to remember . I am looking forward to my next visit and doing something more special for all these lovely people who have given us so much warmth and love to me .

Green pitch in Ahmedabad? Rohit Sharma hints at simulating English conditions ahead of WTC final  - India Today India TodayDailyOIndiaTodayNEMalayalamBusiness TodayAaj TakLallantopBanglaGNTTViChowkReader’s DigestSports TakCrime TakAstro TakGamingHarper's BazaarBrides TodayCosmopolitanIshq FMAaj Tak CampusKisan TakMagazineLIVELive TVSearchSEARCHTRENDING TOPICSSIGN INDark ModeHomePersonaliseLive TVIndiaWorldBusinessTechnologyShowbuzzSportsScienceHealthNews AnalysisHappiness QuestMagazineTrendingNewsMoVideosLifestyleEnvironmentEducationLaw TodayAutoCitiesCrimePodcastsOpinionHoroscopesWeatherInteractivesVisual StoriesCryptoFact CheckDIUPhotosCode of EthicsNewsNewsSportsCricketGreen pitch in Ahmedabad? Rohit hints India will rehearse for WTC final Green pitch in Ahmedabad? Rohit Sharma hints at simulating English conditions ahead of WTC final India vs Australia: Captain Rohit Sharma hinted that the pitch for the 4th Test in Ahmedabad might be seamer-friendly as India look to prepare for the World Test Championship final, which will be played in London in June. India will take on Australia in the 3rd of the 4-Test series in Indore from Wednesday, March 1. AdvertisementIndia Today Sports DeskNew Delhi,UPDATED: Feb 28, 2023 19:05 ISTGreen pitch in Ahmedabad? Rohit hints India will rehearse for WTC final (PTI Photo)In ShortIndia and Australia will meet in the 3rd Test in Indore from WednesdayThe 4th Test will be played in Ahmedabad from March 9India need to win one of the remaining 2 Tests to reach the WTC finalBy India Today Sports Desk: India captain Rohit Sharma hinted on Tuesday that the pitch for the 4th and final Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia could have a green tinge as India are planning to simulate English conditions in the lead-up to the World Test Championship final. India are yet to secure their place in the WTC final, which will be held at the Oval in London. advertisementIndia need a 3-0 or a 3-1 result against Australia in the ongoing series to assure themselves of a place in the final of the World Test Championship for the second successive time. India lost to New Zealand in the final of the inaugural edition of the WTC in England in 2021. While stressing that their focus is on winning the 3rd Test, starting March 1 in Indore, Rohit Sharma said the team has already spoken about the chances of having a seamer-friendly pitch in the final Test in Ahmedabad. Notably, Australia are also favourites to reach the WTC final despite their horror show so far and playing against Australia on a green pitch will only aid the preparations for India. "It will be a different ball game (facing Australia in England) for both teams, actually. There is definitely a possibility of that (Ahmedabad as preparatory game for WTC final). We have already spoken about it. We need to get the guys ready for it," Rohit said on the eve of the 3rd Test in Indore. "The important one is Shardul Thakur, because he comes into the planning for us. We don't know how ready he is since he has just got married (laughs). We don't know how many overs he has bowled. But that thought process is definitely there."If we get the result we want here (Indore), we might think of doing something different in Ahmedabad for sure."But we are not there yet. We have to win this game and then talk about it. That'll be the right thing to do," he said."You are never in on these wickets," he added. CHALLENGING HOME CONDITIONSFurthermore, Rohit Sharma said he is proud of the fact that India are on the cusp of reaching the World Test Championship final, talking up their dominance at home. India will win their 16th straight Test series at home if they manage to win one of the two remaining Tests against Australia. India hammered Australia by an innings and 132 runs in the first Test in Nagpur before dominating the visitors in the 2nd Test in Delhi for a 6-wicket win. Both Tests ended inside 2 days as Australia had no answers to the spin duo of R Ashwin and Ravindra Jadeja. advertisement"Yes there are home conditions but they are challenging conditions; it is not easy for the batters to score runs consistently," Rohit added. "Yeah....that's the beauty of this game and the pitches we are playing on. It can happen to us as well, not just them. I played 200 balls in Nagpur and never felt set. It just takes one ball to grip or keep low and you are out. On pitches like this, you are never in."Yes, we have quality spinners who can change things around just like that but that does not give us the guarantee that we are going to win the Test or roll them over in one session. We have got to keep the discipline going," he said.--- ENDS ---Also Read |  India vs Australia: KL Rahul's removal as vice-captain doesn't indicate anything, says Rohit Sharma

text: Pakistan court issues non-bailable arrest warrant against Imran Khan in Toshakhana case - Times of IndiaTop SearchesTurkey Earthquake LiveRussia Ukraine WarNew Guinea EarthquakeDeadliest Earthquakes in WorldNew Zealand CyclonePakistan Petrol PriceEl Paso ShootingTitanic WreckageUkraine WarEditionININUSSign InTOIworldPakistanUSSouth AsiaUKEuropeChinaMiddle EastRest of WorldMad, Mad WorldPhotosVideosNewsWorld NewsPakistan NewsPakistan court issues non-bailable arrest warrant against Imran Khan in Toshakhana casePakistan court issues non-bailable arrest warrant against Imran Khan in Toshakhana casePTI /  Feb 28, 2023, 19:16 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeARTICLESPakistan court issues non-bailable arrest warrant against Imran Khan in Toshakhana caseBought an EV? Now protect the EV with electric vehicle Insurance'Pakistan staring at worst medicine crisis': Essential drugs, supplies stuck at ports due to low forex reserveWith debt stressing its ties with China, CPEC is no Marshall Plan for PakistanFormer Pakistan PM Imran Khan (Reuters photo)ISLAMABAD: A Pakistani court on Tuesday issued a non-bailable arrest warrant against former prime minister Imran Khan in the Toshakhana case but he was granted bail in two other cases, amid high drama outside the court premises where hundreds of his supporters converged in support of their leader.Khan, the Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) chief, travelled from his Zaman Park residence in Lahore to Islamabad to appear in three cases here in the federal capital.Additional sessions judge Zafar Iqbal issued a non-bailable arrest warrant against the 70-year-year-old prime minister in the Toshakhana case.The court issued a non-bailable arrest warrant against Khan and adjourned the hearing till March 7 for his repeated failure to appear before the court.His indictment, in this case, was earlier postponed twice due to his absence.Khan has been in the crosshairs for buying gifts, including an expensive Graff wristwatch he had received as the premier at a discounted price from the state depository called Toshakhana and selling them for profit.The former cricketer-turned-politician was, however, granted bail by the Anti-Terrorism court (ATC) as well as the banking court in the prohibited funding case as he appeared here in the judicial complex as hundreds of his supporters thronged the vicinity.Meanwhile, ATC judge Raza Jawed granted Khan interim bail till March 9. The Islamabad Police had registered a terrorism case against Khan and senior PTI leaders for allegedly vandalising state property in response to the Toshakhana case.The Federal Investigation Agency (FIA) in October last year filed a case in an Islamabad-based banking court against Khan and other PTI leaders over allegedly receiving prohibited funding.The Election Commission of Pakistan last year found the party guilty of concealing that it had received the money and also disqualified Khan.The prohibited funding case was filed by estranged PTI founding member Akbar S Babar in the ECP in 2014.Khan has not attended any hearings since November last year when he was injured in an assassination attempt at his rally in the Wazirabad area of Punjab.Khan was granted interim bail by a special court in Islamabad after being shot during the assassination attempt.He has since received extensions on his bail due to medical reasons.Khan was ousted from power in April after losing a no-confidence vote in his leadership, which he alleged was part of a US-led conspiracy targeting him because of his independent foreign policy decisions on Russia, China, and Afghanistan.The PTI chief, who came to power in 2018, is the only Pakistani prime minister to be ousted in a no-confidence vote in Parliament.Start a ConversationFOLLOW US ON SOCIAL MEDIAFacebookTwitterInstagramKOO text:
Bihar: Galwan Valley Martyr's Father Allegedly Thrashed, Arrested Over Encroachment | India News | Zee Newsहिन्दीEnglishमराठीবাংলাதமிழ்മലയാളംગુજરાતીతెలుగుಕನ್ನಡBusinessTechWorldHealthNEWSVIDEOSPHOTOSWeb StoriesLogoutSign InLogoutGOHomeLive TVWomen Achievers AwardsLatest NewsIndiaAhmedabadBengaluruChennaiHyderabadKolkataMumbaiPuneMY MONEYCricketEntertainmentHollywoodMusicBollywoodTelevisionRegionalMovie ReviewSportsFootballTennisBadmintonOther SportsLifestyleRelationshipTravelFood & RecipesFashionCultureSpiritualityBusinessEconomyMarketsCompaniesReal EstateInternational BusinessPersonal FinanceAutomobileWorldAsiaAfricaAmericasAustralia-OceaniaEuropeMobilityViral newsDiabytesTechnologyGadgetGamingInternet & Social MediaAppsMobileLive TVWomen Achievers AwardsLatest NewsIndiaMY MONEYCricketEntertainmentSportsLifestyleBusinessWorldMobilityViral newsDiabytesHomeLive TVWomen Achievers AwardsLatest NewsIndiaMY MONEYCricketEntertainmentSportsLifestyleBusinessWorldMobilityViral newsDiabytesTechnologyXtopStoriesenglish2578020NewsIndiaGALWAY VALLEY CLASHBihar: Galwan Valley Martyr's Father Allegedly Thrashed, Arrested Over EncroachmentThe kins of the Indian Army jawan, who was martyred in the Galwan Valley clash alleged that his father was thrashed for building a memorial for his son on government land in Jandaha in Bihar`s Vaishali.
Edited By:  Zee Media Bureau|Last Updated: Feb 28, 2023, 03:40 PM IST|Source: Bureau ×Trending Photos7Shardul ThakurShardul Thakur, Mittali Parulkar's Wedding: India All-Rounder Shares BEAUTIFUL Photos From Dreamy Wedding - Check6EntertainmentJackky Bhagnani Hosts Party For Singer CKay; Rumoured Couple Ananya Panday-Aditya Roy Kapur Attend: In Pics 6SportsLionel Messi Wins FIFA Award For 7th Time: Check TOP Achievements, in PICS12EntertainmentHoroscope Today, February 28 by Astro Sundeep Kochar: Stop Being Jealous, AquariusVaishali (Bihar): A startling incident has come to light from Bihar's Vaishali district where father of a jawan, who was among the martyred soldiers in the 2020 Galwan Valley clash was thrashed and arrested by the police. The family of the martyred army man alleged that his father was thrashed for building a memorial for his son on government land in Jandaha in Bihar`s Vaishali. At least 20 Indian Army personnel, including a Colonel, were killed in the clash with Chinese troops in the Galwan Valley on the intervening night of June 15-16, the biggest military confrontation in over five decades that has significantly escalated the already volatile border standoff between the two countries.
The jawan whose father was targeted was identified as Jai Kishore Singh. However, the police claimed that the matter is linked to an issue of illegal encroachment, which was in violation of the rights of the landowner.

Also Read: Indian Army Jawan Beaten to Death in Tamil Nadu; DMK Councillor Among 10 Arrested
"On January 23, a case was registered under SC/ST Act over a statue being erected on the land of Hari Nath Ram & on govt land in Jandaha. Later, walls bordering the statue were built. They have not sought any permission. If they wanted, they could have made it in their own land or sought land from the government. There would not have been an issue then. The landowner`s rights being violated due to illegal encroachment," the SDPO Mahua said. 


#CORRECTION | Bihar | Family members of Jai Kishore Singh, who lost his life in the 2020* Galwan Valley clash, allege that Singh's father was thrashed and later arrested by police for building a memorial for his son on govt land in Vaishali's Jandaha. https://t.co/pjeDLCR7ZI pic.twitter.com/QyunOez92t
— ANI (@ANI) February 28, 2023

However, the brother of the martyr, Jai Kishore Singh, who himself is in the armed forces, accused the police of thrashing his father and abusing him. 

"DSP ma`am visited us, asking us to remove the statue within 15 days. I said I will show her the document. Later, the police station in-charge came to our home and beat up my father before arresting him. They also abused my father. I am also in the armed forces personnel," Nand Kishore, brother of Jai Kishore Singh, said. The locals protested against the police action and also chanted `Bharat Mata Ki Jai`.Live TvGalway Valley clashBihargalwan martyrvaishali biharillegal encroachmentMore Stories Manish Sisodia Quits Sisodia Resigns As Delhi Deputy CM, Satyendar Jain Too Quits As Minister Bill Gates Bill Gates Visits RBI HQ In Mumbai; Meets Governor ShaktiKanta Das  Gurugram Men Riding Luxury Car Allegedly Steal Flower Pots From G20 Event in Gurugram snap Snap Joins AI Race; Announces To Integrate OpenAI's ChatGPT With Platform manish sisodia arrest Delhi Excise Policy Case: Manish Sisodia Resigns As Deputy Delhi CM India vs Australia 2023 LIVE Updates | IND VS AUS 3rd Test, Day 1 Cricket Match Live Score Ben stokes I’m Not Going To Lie...: Ben Stokes Opens Up On His Availability For CSK KL Rahul Rohit Sharma REVEALS Real Reason Behind Removing KL Rahul As Vice CaptainComments - Join the DiscussionTrending newsDNA VideoDNA: Famous writer Anant Pai passed away on this day in the year 2011DNA VideoDNA: For the first time in the year 1886, Aluminum was made in the laboratoryDNA VideoDNA: When India's first education minister Abul Kalam Azad died in 1958DNA VideoDNA: When will the Russia-Ukraine war end?DNA VideoDNA: Fear of corona infection, Home becomes 'Jail'

text:
Manish Sisodia, Satyendar Jain Should've Quit Delhi Cabinet Earlier: BJP
NDTVहिंदी न्यूज़BUSINESSMOVIESCRICKETTECHFOODLIFESTYLEHEALTHAUTOCROSSWORDBig BonusSWASTHSHOPPINGLIVE TV LATEST INDIA Elections VIDEO OPINION CITIES WORLD Education OFFBEAT TRENDS FeatureSOUTHPEOPLESciencePhotosWEATHERTV ScheduleTrainsManish Sisodia, Satyendar Jain Should've Quit Delhi Cabinet Earlier: BJPSearch
            ​				                HomeIndia NewsManish Sisodia, Satyendar Jain Should've Quit Delhi Cabinet Earlier: BJP Manish Sisodia, Satyendar Jain Should've Quit Delhi Cabinet Earlier: BJP  BJP's Ravi Shankar Prasad said the Supreme court refused to "grant any indulgence to one of the "most prominent faces of the anti-corruption movement led by Anna Hazare".   India NewsPress Trust of IndiaUpdated: February 28, 2023 7:22 pm ISTThe ministers on Tuesday tendered their resignations to Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal.New Delhi: The BJP on Tuesday described AAP as a party of "cut, commission and corruption" and said its leaders Manish Sisodia and Satyendar Jain should have resigned from the Cabinet much earlier when the graft allegations against them had come to light.Deputy Chief Minister Sisodia was arrested by the CBI on Sunday evening in connection with alleged corruption in the formulation and implementation of the now-scrapped Delhi liquor policy for 2021-22, while Jain is lodged in Tihar Jail in a money laundering case since May last year.The ministers on Tuesday tendered their resignations to Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal, which has been accepted.Hitting out at the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) and its national convener Mr Kejriwal, senior BJP leader Ravi Shankar Prasad said people who claimed to be the "flag bearers of the fight against corruption" have ensured governance that "increases the number of alcohol users in Delhi".Without naming any party, Mr Prasad said he thought cut and the commission was the legacy of only one political party."But today, I must say that 3C-cut, commission, and corruption also applies to Mr Kejriwal's party," Mr Prasad said and added that AAP leaders have defamed the anti-corruption agitation led by Anna Hazare."They should have resigned earlier. Mr Jain has resigned several months after his arrest and Mr Sisodia should have resigned at the time when the allegations against them came out," the former law minister said while addressing a press conference here.Describing the liquor scam case in Delhi as a "fixed textbook case of corruption", Mr Prasad said the BJP will raise the issue in every corner of the country.He said the Supreme court on Tuesday refused to "grant any indulgence to one of the "most prominent faces of the anti-corruption movement led by Anna Hazare".  "This clearly indicates the merit of Sisodia's plea that the Supreme Court refused to grant any relief," Mr Prasad said.The Supreme Court on Tuesday refused to entertain the bail plea of Mr Sisodia, who is in CBI custody in connection with the excise policy case.Mr Sisodia is perhaps the only education minister in the country who is also a "liquor minister", the BJP leader said.On Arvind Kejriwal, Mr Prasad said that during the Gujarat elections, he claimed that the Intelligence Bureau was reporting a big win for the AAP, and on Monday, he claimed that the CBI was not in favour of Sisodia's arrest.PromotedListen to the latest songs, only on JioSaavn.com"I am amazed at the number of lies spewed by Mr Kejriwal for the commission from liquor," he said.(Except for the headline, this story has not been edited by NDTV staff and is published from a syndicated feed.)Featured Video Of The DayOn Camera, Bihar Cops Drag, Arrest Father Of Soldier Who Died In GalwanTrack Latest News Live on NDTV.com and get news updates from India  and around the world. text: Jagan Mohan Reddy dares Chandrababu Naidu, Pawan Kalyan to contest all 175 seats in Andhra Pradesh if they have guts | Vijayawada News - Times of IndiaTop SearchesDelhi Excise Policy CaseMeghalaya EarthquakeMumbai Train AccidentManish Sisodia NewsLeh Ice Wall ClimbingBihar Budget 2023 LiveB S YediyurrappaEditionININUSSign  regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnapuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivisakhapatnamphotosweatherpollution newsandhra electionsNewsCity Newsvijayawada NewsJagan Mohan Reddy dares Chandrababu Naidu, Pawan Kalyan to contest all 175 seats in Andhra Pradesh if they have gutsJagan Mohan Reddy dares Chandrababu Naidu, Pawan Kalyan to contest all 175 seats in Andhra Pradesh if they have gutsSamdani MN / TNN / Updated: Feb 28, 2023, 15:44 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeARTICLESJagan Mohan Reddy dares Chandrababu Naidu, Pawan Kalyan to contest all 175 seats in Andhra Pradesh if they have gutsBought an EV? Now protect the EV with electric vehicle InsuranceDaily direct flight to Shirdi from VijFree bus service from Ratham centre to hill topThe Andhra Pradesh CM said that he will win all the 175 seats as he has trust in the public. TENALI (GUNTUR): Andhra Pradesh chief minister YS Jagan Mohan Reddy on Tuesday dared TDP supremo Chandrababu Naidu and Janasena chief Pawan Kalyan to contest in all the 175 assembly constituencies in the state if they have guts to face the public.He said that he is going "to win all the 175 seats" as he has trust in the public and blessings of God. He appealed to people to extend their support to him only if they benefited during his rule. The chief minister released the financial assistance to the farmers under YSR Rythu Bharosa-PM Kisan in Tenali in Guntur district on Tuesday. He transferred nearly Rs 1,090 crore into the accounts of over 52 lakh farmers under the scheme. The CM had also disbursed the input subsidy Rs 77 crore to about 90,000 farmers who lost the crop due to the Mandous cyclone.Addressing a public meeting held in the agriculture market yard premises, the chief minister lashed out at opposition parties for deliberately misleading the people with the support of their own media houses. He said that Naidu depended on a poisonous campaign and he had no courage to seek votes on the schemes and projects taken up during his regime. “We have done good to each and every family in the last four years. We have kept all of our promises. In contrast, your son (referring to himself) has courage to seek votes based on his performance,” claimed Jagan. He said that they have distributed over Rs 27,000 crore to the farmers giving nearly Rs 54,000 financial assistance to each farmer in the last four years. “The state will prosper only when the farmer is happy. There is no drought in the last four years since your son (Jagan) took over the reins of the state. The state reeled under severe drought conditions throughout the five-year rule under Naidu,” said the CM. He said that Naidu was synonymous with drought whenever he headed the state.He said that next elections would be held between the party (YSRCP), which modernized the schools for the better future of the children from poor families, and the party (referring to TDP) which opposed the development of the schools. He said that it would be a battle between the party (YSRCP) which took the sides of the poor and the party which backed the corporate firms. He said that there would be a tussle between the party which took healthcare to the villages in a span of just four years and the party which had completely neglected the public healthcare system.Jagan wanted the people to see the difference between the TDP and YSRCP regime and extend their support to them to continue the empowerment of the weaker sections in all spheres. He lashed out at Naidu for opposing the grant of house-sites to the poor as he was unable to digest the initiative of YSRCP government. He said that Naidu could not implement the welfare schemes initiated by YSRCP government as he was never a pro-poor leader. He termed TDP as Tinuko (Eat)-Dochuko(Loot)-Panchuko (Distribute among the gang) as it had looted the public monies for the benefit of Naidu’s coterie. He said that they have disbursed over Rs 2.2 lakh crore through DBT to the poor through various welfare schemes in a transparent mode of distribution.Jagan exuded confidence that he would return to
