'There Won't Be Hung Assembly, BJP-Led NDA Will Form Govt In All 3 Northeastern States': Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma | India News | Zee Newsहिन्दीEnglishमराठीবাংলাதமிழ்മലയാളംગુજરાતીతెలుగుಕನ್ನಡBusinessTechWorldHealthNEWSVIDEOSPHOTOSWeb StoriesLogoutSign InLogoutGOHomeLive TVWomen Achievers AwardsLatest NewsIndiaAhmedabadBengaluruChennaiHyderabadKolkataMumbaiPuneMY MONEYCricketEntertainmentHollywoodMusicBollywoodTelevisionRegionalMovie ReviewSportsFootballTennisBadmintonOther SportsLifestyleRelationshipTravelFood & RecipesFashionCultureSpiritualityBusinessEconomyMarketsCompaniesReal EstateInternational BusinessPersonal FinanceAutomobileWorldAsiaAfricaAmericasAustralia-OceaniaEuropeMobilityViral newsDiabytesTechnologyGadgetGamingInternet & Social MediaAppsMobileLive TVWomen Achievers AwardsLatest NewsIndiaMY MONEYCricketEntertainmentSportsLifestyleBusinessWorldMobilityViral newsDiabytesHomeLive TVWomen Achievers AwardsLatest NewsIndiaMY MONEYCricketEntertainmentSportsLifestyleBusinessWorldMobilityViral newsDiabytesTechnologyXtopStoriesenglish2577989NewsIndiaELECTION 2023'There Won't Be Hung Assembly, BJP-Led NDA Will Form Govt In All 3 Northeastern States': Assam CM Himanta Biswa SarmaNortheast Polls: Assam CM Sarma, who is also the NEDA convenor, has said that no NDA partner will go into any alliance with either Congress or the Trinamool Congress.
Written By  Zee Media Bureau|Last Updated: Feb 28, 2023, 03:06 PM IST|Source: Bureau ×Trending Photos7Shardul ThakurShardul Thakur, Mittali Parulkar's Wedding: India All-Rounder Shares BEAUTIFUL Photos From Dreamy Wedding - Check6EntertainmentJackky Bhagnani Hosts Party For Singer CKay; Rumoured Couple Ananya Panday-Aditya Roy Kapur Attend: In Pics 6SportsLionel Messi Wins FIFA Award For 7th Time: Check TOP Achievements, in PICS12EntertainmentHoroscope Today, February 28 by Astro Sundeep Kochar: Stop Being Jealous, AquariusNEW DELHI: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma has expressed confidence that there would be no hung assemblies in the three northeastern states – Tripura, Nagaland and Meghalaya – that recently went to polls and that the coalition led by his party BJP will form the government there. “There won't be a hung assembly in any northeastern state. NDA will form govt in Tripura, Nagaland, Meghalaya,” Sarma said.

The Assam Chief Minister, who is also the NEDA convenor, further said that “Tripura will have a BJP CM, Nagaland will have a coalition government while that of Meghalaya will be decided as per seats won by the BJP.”

Sarma also said, "No NDA (National Democratic Alliance) partners will go into any alliance with either Congress or the Trinamool Congress. There will be no hung assembly. The NDA will form the government in all three states." 

Sarma’s remarks came a day after exit polls predicted that the ruling NDPP-BJP alliance would retain power in Nagaland. The exit polls showed while BJP has a clear edge over its rivals in Tripura, it predicted a close race in Meghalaya. The outcome of exit polls was telecast by news channels after the conclusion of polling in Meghalaya and Nagaland on Monday. 

Tripura
 

Tripura had gone to the polls on February 16. In Tripura where the BJP created history in 2018 by wresting the state from Left parties, the exit polls predicted that the BJP will be ahead of its rivals or get majority. India Today-Axis My India exit poll predicted that BJP would get 36-45 seats and the Left-Congress will get 6-11 seats. The exit poll gave 9-16 seats to Tipra Motha. The ZeeNews-Matrize exit poll predicted that BJP-IPFT will get 29-36 seats in the 60-member House. It said that Left-Congress combine is poised to get 13-21 seats and Tipra Motha 11-16.
The ETG-Times Now poll predicted BJP would get 24 seats, Left-Congress would get 21 seats and Tipra Motha 14 seats. The BJP had won 36 seats in the 2018 assembly election.

Nagaland
 

For the 60-member Nagaland assembly, India Today-Axis My India exit poll predicted that the NDPP-BJP alliance would get 38 to 48 seats. It said Congress is likely to win 1-2 seats, NPF may win 3-8 seats and other parties could get 5-15 seats. According to the Zee-Matriz exit poll, the NDPP-BJP alliance could get 35-43 seats. ETG-Times Now poll gave 27-33 seats to NDPP, 12-16 seats to BJP and 4-8 seats to NPF. 

Meghalaya
 
In the 60-member Meghalaya assembly, the Zee-Matrize exit poll predicted NPP will get 21-26 seats, Trinamool Congress 8-13 seats, BJP 6-11 seats and Congress 3-6 seats. India Today-Axis My India exit poll for the state predicted NPP getting 18-24 seats, Congress (6-12), BJP (4-8), UDP (8-12 seats) and TMC (5-9) seats. Times Now ETG exit poll predicted that NPP will get 18-26 seats, AITMC 8-14 seats, UDP 8-14 seats and BJP 3-6 seats.

Assembly elections were held in Tripura on February 16, and in Nagaland and Meghalaya on February 27. Results will be declared on March 2. The counting of votes in all three states will take place on March 2.Live Tvelection 2023MeghalayaTripuraNagalandHimanta Biswa SarmaNortheast Elections 2023Exit Polls 2023AssamBJPNDAMore Stories Manish Sisodia Quits Sisodia Resigns As Delhi Deputy CM, Satyendar Jain Too Quits As Minister Bill Gates Bill Gates Visits RBI HQ In Mumbai; Meets Governor ShaktiKanta Das  Gurugram Men Riding Luxury Car Allegedly Steal Flower Pots From G20 Event in Gurugram snap Snap Joins AI Race; Announces To Integrate OpenAI's ChatGPT With Platform manish sisodia arrest Delhi Excise Policy Case: Manish Sisodia Resigns As Deputy Delhi CM India vs Australia 2023 LIVE Updates | IND VS AUS 3rd Test, Day 1 Cricket Match Live Score Ben stokes I’m Not Going To Lie...: Ben Stokes Opens Up On His Availability For CSK KL Rahul Rohit Sharma REVEALS Real Reason Behind Removing KL Rahul As Vice CaptainComments - Join the DiscussionTrending newsDNA VideoDNA: Famous writer Anant Pai passed away on this day in the year 2011DNA VideoDNA: For the first time in the year 1886, Aluminum was made in the laboratoryDNA VideoDNA: When India's first education minister Abul Kalam Azad died in 1958DNA VideoDNA: When will the Russia-Ukraine war end?DNA VideoDNA: Fear of corona infection, Home becomes 'Jail'

Elon Musk has almost finalised the new Twitter CEO and he is an insider - India Today India TodayDailyOIndiaTodayNEMalayalamBusiness TodayAaj TakLallantopBanglaGNTTViChowkReader’s DigestSports TakCrime TakAstro TakGamingHarper's BazaarBrides TodayCosmopolitanIshq FMAaj Tak CampusKisan TakMagazineLIVELive TVSearchSEARCHTRENDING TOPICSSIGN INDark ModeHomePersonaliseLive TVIndiaWorldBusinessTechnologyShowbuzzSportsScienceHealthNews AnalysisHappiness QuestMagazineTrendingNewsMoVideosLifestyleEnvironmentEducationLaw TodayAutoCitiesCrimePodcastsOpinionHoroscopesWeatherInteractivesVisual StoriesCryptoFact CheckDIUPhotosCode of EthicsNewsNewsTechnologyNewsElon Musk has almost finalised the new Twitter CEO, and he is an insiderElon Musk has almost finalised the new Twitter CEO, and he is an insiderIf Elon Musk steps down from Twitter CEO position, who will be the head of Twitter next? Looks like the richest man in the world has a replacement in mind already.AdvertisementSneha SahaNew Delhi,UPDATED: Feb 28, 2023 19:09 ISTIn ShortElon Musk fired Parag Agrawal as soon as he acquired Twitter.Musk acquired Twitter for $44 billion.Musk plans to step down from Twitter CEO position later this year.By Sneha Saha: Elon Musk fired Parag Agrawal as soon as he acquired Twitter for $44 billion last year and became the new CEO. But, Musk plans to step down from the CEO's position by the end of this year, he confirmed during a recent interview. Now the question is – if Musk steps down from the Twitter CEO position, who will be the head of Twitter next? Looks like the richest man in the world has a replacement in mind already and he is an insider.advertisementAccording to reports, Musk may announce Steve Davis, who is the CEO of The Boring Company, as the next Twitter CEO very soon. For the unaware, Davis has long been an associate of Musk and knows how the billionaire works. In one of his tweets, Musk also said that he would appoint a new Twitter CEO but continue to have the power in his hands. It is highly likely that Musk will bring someone he knows and has worked with closely, as the new Twitter CEO.Going by a recent report from Platformer, Davis worked for Twitter as a part of Musk’s transition team last year. The billionaire reportedly tasked Davis to cut USD 500 million in costs but he ended up cutting around USD 1 billion. "His success in bringing costs down by any means necessary has led to growing speculation internally that Musk will choose him to be Twitter's next CEO," the report stated.Davis has been a part of Musk’s core Twitter team since his takeover and was also responsible for the recent changes as well as layoffs. The company recently fired 200 employees, which is about 10 per cent of the workforce, and it is said that Davis has a key role to play in it. While Musk hasn’t revealed many details about the latest layoffs, reports suggest that product managers, engineers, and people in data science have been impacted the most. In fact, Musk also fired Esther Crawford, who was heading projects such as Blue verification subscription and the upcoming payments platform. Additionally, Chris Reidy, who was the acting Twitter head of sales, was also asked to leave during the latest round of layoffs.Musk fired over 50 per cent of the workforce as soon as he acquired Twitter last year. Following the harsh layoffs came many more rounds of job cuts and later Musk promised not to cut any more jobs at the firm. Looks like the current Twitter CEO isn’t living up to his words and firing employees at regular intervals. In India too, Musk has laid off hundreds of employees in the last few months. In fact, some reports suggest that Musk has shut down two out of three offices in India to cut costs.Now, we will have to wait to see who officially becomes the next Twitter CEO.--- ENDS ---Also read |  Motorola Rizr rollable concept first impressions: This is mind-blowingAlso read |  Oppo Find N2 first impressions: The handy foldable

I hadn't seen my husband Krushna for weeks, so I kissed him publicly: Kashmera ShahBy - TNNTanvi TrivediCreated: Feb 28, 2023, 19:32 ISTKashmera Shah on pledging support for Rakhi Sawant at a party and indulging in PDA with husband and actor Krushna Abhishek. facebooktwitterPintrestKashmera Shah; with Krushna Abhishek at the partyKashmera Shah was recently spotted with husband and actor Krushna Abhishek at a party thrown for Bigg Boss 16 contestants. When someone asked her about Rakhi, she pledged her support for the actress and shared how she missed her and will do anything to get her out of the trouble she is going through currently because of her husband Adil Durrani. She said, "Rakhi and I have been frenemies. I have known her because of Bigg Boss. Her entire issue with Adil is her personal issue and I would not want to get into it, but I am here to support her. I call her a frenemy because we have even fought equally many times. But if she is going through a crisis, then however she is or whatever people speak about her, I will always be there for her."At the same party, Kashmera was spotted indulging in PDA with husband Krushna and netizens commented on it. Ask her about it and she says, "Yes, I know people thought I was heavily drunk and therefore could not stand properly. The real reason was I was jetlagged. I had just returned from LA, reached home and then went to the party, so I could barely stand. I did have a glass of wine so if that made me tipsy, I wouldn't know. Yes I was pulling my husband towards me and indulging in PDA because I had not met him for a long time. It was almost 3 weeks and I missed him very much. I was PDA-starved and that's why I kissed Krushna at the party publicly. I was also missing my kids. Next, we are planning to go to LA again soon for a holiday."End of the articleVisual StoriesRight arrowEntertainmentMarathi actresses who stunned in a floral outfitsLife Style19 habits a good spouse should haveTVRang Majha Vegla actress Anushka Pimputkar's purple saree photoshoot is all about eleganceLife StyleMuslim baby boy names with meaning from QuranTVTejasswi Prakash stuns in a green shimmer dress; Chandrayaan-3 Mission: ISRO Successfully Conducts Key Test Ahead Of Launch In June | India News | Zee Newsहिन्दीEnglishमराठीবাংলাதமிழ்മലയാളംગુજરાતીతెలుగుಕನ್ನಡBusinessTechWorldHealthNEWSVIDEOSPHOTOSWeb StoriesLogoutSign InLogoutGOHomeLive TVWomen Achievers AwardsLatest NewsIndiaAhmedabadBengaluruChennaiHyderabadKolkataMumbaiPuneMY MONEYCricketEntertainmentHollywoodMusicBollywoodTelevisionRegionalMovie ReviewSportsFootballTennisBadmintonOther SportsLifestyleRelationshipTravelFood & RecipesFashionCultureSpiritualityBusinessEconomyMarketsCompaniesReal EstateInternational BusinessPersonal FinanceAutomobileWorldAsiaAfricaAmericasAustralia-OceaniaEuropeMobilityViral newsDiabytesTechnologyGadgetGamingInternet & Social MediaAppsMobileLive TVWomen Achievers AwardsLatest NewsIndiaMY MONEYCricketEntertainmentSportsLifestyleBusinessWorldMobilityViral newsDiabytesHomeLive TVWomen Achievers AwardsLatest NewsIndiaMY MONEYCricketEntertainmentSportsLifestyleBusinessWorldMobilityViral newsDiabytesTechnologyXtopStoriesenglish2577965NewsIndiaCHANDRAYAAN-3 MISSIONChandrayaan-3 Mission: ISRO Successfully Conducts Key Test Ahead Of Launch In JuneChandrayaan-3 is ISRO's follow-on mission to Chandrayaan-2 to demonstrate end-to-end capability in safe landing and roving on the lunar surface.
Edited By:  Zee Media Bureau|Last Updated: Feb 28, 2023, 01:40 PM IST|Source: PTI ×Trending Photos7Shardul ThakurShardul Thakur, Mittali Parulkar's Wedding: India All-Rounder Shares BEAUTIFUL Photos From Dreamy Wedding - Check6EntertainmentJackky Bhagnani Hosts Party For Singer CKay; Rumoured Couple Ananya Panday-Aditya Roy Kapur Attend: In Pics 6SportsLionel Messi Wins FIFA Award For 7th Time: Check TOP Achievements, in PICS12EntertainmentHoroscope Today, February 28 by Astro Sundeep Kochar: Stop Being Jealous, AquariusBengaluru: The flight acceptance hot test of the CE-20 cryogenic engine that will power the cryogenic upper stage of the launch vehicle for the Chandrayaan-3 mission was successfully conducted, according to the Indian Space Research Organisation. The hot test was carried out for a planned duration of 25 seconds at the High Altitude Test Facility of the ISRO Propulsion Complex at Mahendragiri in Tamil Nadu on February 24, the Bengaluru-headquartered national space agency said.

"All the propulsion parameters during the test were found satisfactory and closely matched with predictions," an ISRO statement said on Monday.

The cryogenic engine will be further integrated with the propellant tanks, stage structures and associated fluid lines to realise the fully-integrated flight cryogenic stage, ISRO said.

Earlier this year, Chandrayaan-3 lander successfully underwent EMI/EMC test at U R Rao Satellite Centre here.

EMI-EMC (Electro - Magnetic Interference/ Electro - Magnetic Compatibility) test is conducted for satellite missions to ensure the functionality of the satellite subsystems in the space environment and their compatibility with the expected electromagnetic levels, it was noted.

"This test is a major milestone in the realisation of the satellites," ISRO had said.

Chandrayaan-3 interplanetary mission has three major modules: the propulsion module, lander module, and a rover. The mission's complexity calls for establishing radio-frequency (RF) communication links between the modules.
During the Chandrayaan-3 lander EMI/EC test, launcher compatibility, antenna polarisation of all RF systems, standalone auto compatibility tests for orbital and powered descent mission phases, and lander and rover compatibility tests for post landing mission phase were ensured, according to ISRO.

Chandrayaan-3 is a follow-on mission to Chandrayaan-2 to demonstrate end-to-end capability in safe landing and roving on the lunar surface. ISRO plans to launch the mission in June.

It will be launched by Launch Vehicle Mark 3 (LVM3) from the Satish Dhawan Space Centre in Sriharikota (Andhra Pradesh).

The propulsion module will carry the lander and rover configuration till 100 km lunar orbit. The propulsion module has Spectro-polarimetry of Habitable Planet Earth (SHAPE) payload to study the spectral and polari metric measurements of Earth from the lunar orbit.Live TvChandrayaan-3 MissionISROchandrayaan 3 missionChandrayaan 3ChandrayaanMore Stories Manish Sisodia Quits Sisodia Resigns As Delhi Deputy CM, Satyendar Jain Too Quits As Minister Bill Gates Bill Gates Visits RBI HQ In Mumbai; Meets Governor ShaktiKanta Das  Gurugram Men Riding Luxury Car Allegedly Steal Flower Pots From G20 Event in Gurugram snap Snap Joins AI Race; Announces To Integrate OpenAI's ChatGPT With Platform manish sisodia arrest Delhi Excise Policy Case: Manish Sisodia Resigns As Deputy Delhi CM India vs Australia 2023 LIVE Updates | IND VS AUS 3rd Test, Day 1 Cricket Match Live Score Ben stokes I’m Not Going To Lie...: Ben Stokes Opens Up On His Availability For CSK KL Rahul Rohit Sharma REVEALS Real Reason Behind Removing KL Rahul As Vice CaptainComments - Join the DiscussionTrending newsDNA VideoDNA: Famous writer Anant Pai passed away on this day in the year 2011DNA VideoDNA: For the first time in the year 1886, Aluminum was made in the laboratoryDNA VideoDNA: When India's first education minister Abul Kalam Azad died in 1958DNA VideoDNA: When will the Russia-Ukraine war end?DNA VideoDNA: Fear of corona infection, Home becomes 'Jail'

'It has begun': UP minister on CM Yogi Adityanath's 'mitti main mila denge' warning to gangsters - India Today India TodayDailyOIndiaTodayNEMalayalamBusiness TodayAaj TakLallantopBanglaGNTTViChowkReader’s DigestSports TakCrime TakAstro TakGamingHarper's BazaarBrides TodayCosmopolitanIshq FMAaj Tak CampusKisan TakMagazineLIVELive TVSearchSEARCHTRENDING TOPICSSIGN INDark ModeHomePersonaliseLive TVIndiaWorldBusinessTechnologyShowbuzzSportsScienceHealthNews AnalysisHappiness QuestMagazineTrendingNewsMoVideosLifestyleEnvironmentEducationLaw TodayAutoCitiesCrimePodcastsOpinionHoroscopesWeatherInteractivesVisual StoriesCryptoFact CheckDIUPhotosCode of EthicsNewsNewsIndia'It has begun': UP minister on CM Yogi's 'mitti main mila denge' warning to gangsters'It has begun': UP minister on CM Yogi Adityanath's 'mitti main mila denge' warning to gangstersJPS Rathore, a minister in the Yogi government and general secretary of the Uttar Pradesh BJP, said the state government has started the process to eliminate criminals. AdvertisementShilpi SenPrayagraj,UPDATED: Feb 28, 2023 19:35 ISTGeneral secretary of the Uttar Pradesh BJP JPS Rathore (right) said the UP government has zero tolerance for crimes. (Photo: Facebook)By Shilpi Sen: Days after Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath said he would end the rule of mafias in the state, state minister JPS Rathore said the government has started the process to eliminate criminals. The statement comes a day after Arbaz, one of the accused in the Umesh Pal murder case, was killed in an encounter with police in Prayagraj. Umesh Pal, a prime witness to the 2005 murder of BSP MLA Raju Pal, was earlier shot dead by assailants outside his residence. advertisement"The chief minister said in the Assembly that we will turn criminals to dust. The process has begun. We have started taking strict action against criminals. We will not spare any criminal, nor will we tolerate any crime in Uttar Pradesh," said Rathore. Earlier, while addressing an Assembly session on February 25, CM Yogi Adityanath accused the Samajwadi Party of patronising mafia (criminals) and said ‘unko mitti mein mila denge’ (we will turn them to dust).Also Read | Umesh Pal murder: Gangster Atiq Ahmed's wife moves court, says sons taken away by UP copsAlluding to notorious criminal Vikas Dubey's death, Rathore said, "You have seen what happened in Prayagraj. All criminals are scared. But I also want to tell them that if they are caught, they should not make hue and cry because the police vehicle they may be travelling in may overturn."Vikas Dubey was being brought back from Ujjain to UP's Kanpur in a police convoy when he was shot dead. The police said the car in which Dubey was travelling flipped and he snatched a policeman's gun, tried to escape and opened fire before they shot him.Also Read | Plot hatched in Bareilly jail, attackers met in hostel: How Umesh Pal's murder was executedOn the Samajwadi Party tweeting a photo of Sadaqat Khan -- the key accused in the Umesh Pal murder case -- with Udaybhan Karwariya--the husband of a BJP leader, Rathore said action will be taken against whoever is guilty. "Be it a member of any party, we will not spare anyone."The media cell of the Samajwadi party shared a photo alleging Sadaqat was currently a member of BJP, who is being linked with the Samajwadi Party.

NDTVहिंदी न्यूज़BUSINESSMOVIESCRICKETTECHFOODLIFESTYLEHEALTHAUTOCROSSWORDBig BonusSWASTHSHOPPINGLIVE TV LATEST INDIA Elections VIDEO OPINION CITIES WORLD Education OFFBEAT TRENDS FeatureSOUTHPEOPLESciencePhotosWEATHERTV ScheduleTrainsTrinamool Twitter Account Restored After More Than 13 HoursSearch
            ​				                HomeIndia NewsTrinamool Twitter Account Restored After More Than 13 Hours Trinamool Twitter Account Restored After More Than 13 Hours  The account was hacked late on Monday night and its name was changed to 'Yuga Labs', sources in the party said.

 India NewsPress Trust of IndiaUpdated: February 28, 2023 7:12 pm ISTThe official Twitter account of TMC was restored after more than 13 hours.New Delhi/ Kolkata: The official Twitter account of TMC was restored after more than 13 hours on Tuesday evening, party officials said.The account was hacked late on Monday night and its name was changed to 'Yuga Labs', sources in the party said."It was restored at around 4 PM after nearly 13 hours," a member of the AITC media team said.The party lodged a complaint with the cyber cell of Kolkata Police, he said.TMC national spokesperson Derek O'Brien said in a statement this morning that the account was compromised. "We are in touch with officials from Twitter who are working to rectify the issue. They have assured us of prompt action," O'Brien, who is also the leader of the party in Rajya Sabha, said.PromotedListen to the latest songs, only on JioSaavn.comAfter its account was restored, the party, which is in power in Bengal, posted three tweets about 'Didir Suraksha Kavach' (Didi's Protective Shield), its ongoing mass outreach campaign, The TMC launched the campaign in January this year to ensure that people get benefits from the pro-people projects of the state government. Didi or elder sister denotes Party supremo Mamata Banerjee.(Except for the headline, this story has not been edited by NDTV staff and is published from a syndicated feed.)Featured Video Of The DayTerrorist Behind Kashmiri Pandit Killing Among 2 Shot Dead In EncounterAlso ReadHackers Target Trinamool's Twitter Handle, Change Profile Name, Image"Must Stop Poaching Leaders If...": Congress' Latest Jibe At Trinamool"Bandh And Development Can't Go Hand In Hand": Mamata BanerjeeTrack Latest News Live on NDTV.com and get news updates from India  and around the world. text: Stray dog kills infant sleeping next to mother in hospital in Rajasthan | Udaipur News - Times of IndiaTop SearchesDelhi Excise Policy CaseMeghalaya EarthquakeMumbai Train AccidentManish Sisodia NewsLeh Ice Wall ClimbingBihar Budget 2023 LiveB S YediyurrappaEditionININUSSign  regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnapuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosweatherrajasthan electionsNewsCity Newsudaipur NewsStray dog kills infant sleeping next to mother in hospital in RajasthanStray dog kills infant sleeping next to mother in hospital in RajasthanTIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Feb 28, 2023, 16:27 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeARTICLESStray dog kills infant sleeping next to mother in hospital in RajasthanBought an EV? Now protect the EV with electric vehicle Insurance72-year-old man held for raping minorUdaipur’s Navalakha Mahal opened for publicFile photo used for representational purpose.JAIPUR: A baby was taken away by stray dogs and was mauled to death at a hospital in Sirohi district of Rajasthan. The month-old-child was sleeping next to his mother in the TB ward of the hospital, police said.Police said the CCTV footage showed that two dogs went inside the TB ward of the hospital late on Monday and one of them returned with the infant. Sitaram, SHO, Kotwali said the father of the child was admitted in the hospital for tuberculosis treatment. He said the child's mother, who was attending to the patient along with her other children, dozed off. The officer said the hospital staff was also not present at the TB ward at the time of the incident. "Post-mortem has been conducted by a medical board. A case will be registered in the matter after further investigation," the SHO said. Meanwhile, the hospital administration has also initiated a probe into the matter. "The patient's attendant was sleeping and the hospital guard was attending to the other ward. I have not seen the CCTV footage (of the incident). I will be able to comment only after the investigation," Acting Principal Medical Officer (PMO), Sirohi district hospital, Virendra told reporters.(With inputs from PTI)Start a ConversationFOLLOW US Mumbai Police On High Alert, Launches Search To Nab 'Pak-Trained Dangerous' Man On NIA Info | India News | Zee Newsहिन्दीEnglishमराठीবাংলাதமிழ்മലയാളംગુજરાતીతెలుగుಕನ್ನಡBusinessTechWorldHealthNEWSVIDEOSPHOTOSWeb StoriesLogoutSign InLogoutGOHomeLive TVWomen Achievers AwardsLatest NewsIndiaAhmedabadBengaluruChennaiHyderabadKolkataMumbaiPuneMY MONEYCricketEntertainmentHollywoodMusicBollywoodTelevisionRegionalMovie ReviewSportsFootballTennisBadmintonOther SportsLifestyleRelationshipTravelFood & RecipesFashionCultureSpiritualityBusinessEconomyMarketsCompaniesReal EstateInternational BusinessPersonal FinanceAutomobileWorldAsiaAfricaAmericasAustralia-OceaniaEuropeMobilityViral newsDiabytesTechnologyGadgetGamingInternet & Social MediaAppsMobileLive TVWomen Achievers AwardsLatest NewsIndiaMY MONEYCricketEntertainmentSportsLifestyleBusinessWorldMobilityViral newsDiabytesHomeLive TVWomen Achievers AwardsLatest NewsIndiaMY MONEYCricketEntertainmentSportsLifestyleBusinessWorldMobilityViral newsDiabytesTechnologyXtopStoriesenglish2577951NewsIndiaPAK-TRAINED DANGEROUS MANMumbai Police On High Alert, Launches Search To Nab 'Pak-Trained Dangerous' Man On NIA InfoNIA Warns About Pak-Trained Man: In its communication, the NIA has reportedly warned that his man could pose a serious threat to Mumbai`s law and order situation. 
Written By  Zee Media Bureau|Last Updated: Feb 28, 2023, 01:16 PM IST|Source: Bureau ×Trending Photos7Shardul ThakurShardul Thakur, Mittali Parulkar's Wedding: India All-Rounder Shares BEAUTIFUL Photos From Dreamy Wedding - Check6EntertainmentJackky Bhagnani Hosts Party For Singer CKay; Rumoured Couple Ananya Panday-Aditya Roy Kapur Attend: In Pics 6SportsLionel Messi Wins FIFA Award For 7th Time: Check TOP Achievements, in PICS12EntertainmentHoroscope Today, February 28 by Astro Sundeep Kochar: Stop Being Jealous, AquariusMumbai: Mumbai Police are on high alert mode and have launched a search to trace a 'Pakistan-trained dangerous' man after receiving crucial information about his suspected activities in the city from the National Investigation Agency (NIA). According to Mumbai Police officials, "A search for the ''dangerous'' man has been launched after an e-mail was received from the city unit of NIA about his suspicious movements.

"The e-mail from the NIA was received on Sunday afternoon, following which all agencies were put on alert. The NIA communication identified the suspect as Sarfaraz Memon who it said had entered Mumbai, the official said, adding that as Memon hails from Madhya Pradesh, the police in that state have also been alerted.
"While informing about the suspect, NIA officials also shared details like an Aadhaar card, a driving license and a passport. As per information received, the suspect has received training in China, Hong Kong, and Pakistan," the police official said.

In its communication, the NIA reportedly warned that his man could pose a serious threat to Mumbai`s law and order situation. The central anti-terror agency, which is tracking him, said that Memon had reached Mumbai and advised the city police to be more vigilant as he is an "enemy of the state".

A senior Mumbai Police officer later confirmed that an e-mail was received from the NIA and a search is on for the man, according to news agency PTI. Based on the communication received from the NIA, the Mumbai Police has now sought more information about the “dangerous” man from Indore Police.

It may be recalled that in the past couple of months, the Mumbai Police have received several threats of possible terror strikes, but all proved to be hoaxes.Live TvPak-Trained Dangerous ManNIASarfaraz MemonMumbai PoliceIndoreMadhya PradeshHigh alertMumbai newsPakistanMore Stories Manish Sisodia Quits Sisodia Resigns As Delhi Deputy CM, Satyendar Jain Too Quits As Minister Bill Gates Bill Gates Visits RBI HQ In Mumbai; Meets Governor ShaktiKanta Das  Gurugram Men Riding Luxury Car Allegedly Steal Flower Pots From G20 Event in Gurugram snap Snap Joins AI Race; Announces To Integrate OpenAI's ChatGPT With Platform manish sisodia arrest Delhi Excise Policy Case: Manish Sisodia Resigns As Deputy Delhi CM India vs Australia 2023 LIVE Updates | IND VS AUS 3rd Test, Day 1 Cricket Match Live Score Ben stokes I’m Not Going To Lie...: Ben Stokes Opens Up On His Availability For CSK KL Rahul Rohit Sharma REVEALS Real Reason Behind Removing KL Rahul As Vice CaptainComments - Join the DiscussionTrending newsDNA VideoDNA: Famous writer Anant Pai passed away on this day in the year 2011DNA VideoDNA: For the first time in the year 1886, Aluminum was made in the laboratoryDNA VideoDNA: When India's first education minister Abul Kalam Azad died in 1958DNA VideoDNA: When will the Russia-Ukraine war end?DNA VideoDNA: Fear of corona infection, Home becomes 'Jail'

Conspiracy in Bareilly jail, planning in hostel: How accused executed Umesh Pal's murder - India Today India TodayDailyOIndiaTodayNEMalayalamBusiness TodayAaj TakLallantopBanglaGNTTViChowkReader’s DigestSports TakCrime TakAstro TakGamingHarper's BazaarBrides TodayCosmopolitanIshq FMAaj Tak CampusKisan TakMagazineLIVELive TVSearchSEARCHTRENDING TOPICSSIGN INDark ModeHomePersonaliseLive TVIndiaWorldBusinessTechnologyShowbuzzSportsScienceHealthNews AnalysisHappiness QuestMagazineTrendingNewsMoVideosLifestyleEnvironmentEducationLaw TodayAutoCitiesCrimePodcastsOpinionHoroscopesWeatherInteractivesVisual StoriesCryptoFact CheckDIUPhotosCode of EthicsNewsNewsIndiaPlot hatched in Bareilly jail, attackers met in hostel: How Umesh Pal's murder was executedPlot hatched in Bareilly jail, attackers met in hostel: How Umesh Pal's murder was executedThe plot to murder Umesh Pal was hatched in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly jail at the behest of Atiq Ahmed, sources told India Today. The attackers met at a hostel belonging to one of the key conspirators Sadaqat Khan. Umesh Pal, a key witness in the 2005 BSP MLA Raju Pal murder case, was murdered a few days back. AdvertisementIndia Today News DeskNew Delhi,UPDATED: Feb 28, 2023 13:38 ISTThe plan to kill Pal was made after the assailants met Atiq Ahmed's brother Ashraf (In frame: Left (Ashraf, Right: Atiq Ahmed)By India Today News Desk: The conspiracy to kill Umesh Pal was planned at Bareilly jail in Uttar Pradesh at the behest of infamous gangster Atiq Ahmed, sources told India Today. Police on Monday disclosed that a meeting of Umesh Pal's shooters also took place in a room of a hostel that belonged to Sadaqat Khan. Sadaqat Khan is one of the key conspirators of the case and has been arrested by UP Police's Special Task Force (STF). advertisementThe details regarding the plot and the meeting emerged a day after an accused in the Umesh Pal murder case was killed in an encounter in UP's Prayagraj. The plan to kill Umesh Pal was hatched after the assailants met Atiq Ahmed's brother Ashraf, who is lodged in a jail in Bareilly. The accused worked on the details of the conspiracy to kill Umesh Pal in a "room of a Muslim hostel", the commissioner of police said.Atiq Ahmed, who is currently lodged in Sabarmati jail, gave instructions to murder Umesh Pal, said the sources. Umesh Pal, the prime witness in the 2005 BSP MLA Raju Pal murder case, was shot dead last week near his residence in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj, police said. MLA Raju Pal was murdered months after winning the Allahabad (West) Assembly seat in his electoral debut by defeating former MP Atiq Ahmed's younger brother Khalid Azim.ALSO READ | Witness in 2005 BSP MLA murder case shot dead in UP's Prayagraj, ex-MP's sons among 14 heldUP STF has now asked for the list of shooters involved in Umesh Pal's murder from Ashraf. A raid was also carried out by the District Magistrate and Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) in the Bareilly jail where Ashraf is imprisoned. Interestingly, Atiq Ahmed was earlier lodged in Bareilly jail too. Among the most sensational murders in which Atiq Ahmed is allegedly involved was that of Raju Pal. Meanwhile, the security around the barracks where former MLA Ashraf is lodged has been tightened and security agencies are on alert. Sources have said Ashraf and other prisoners may be shifted to another jail. However, an official statement in this regard is awaited.UMESH PAL MURDER ACCUSED KILLED IN ENCOUNTERThe Special Operations Group of the Uttar Pradesh Police and the district police shot an accused in the Umesh Pal murder case, identified as Arbaz, at the Nehru Park in Prayagraj on Monday. Arbaz had a bounty of Rs 50,000 for his arrest. Arbaaz was trying to flee on a bike when police chased him and killed him in an encounter. Police recovered a pistol from him after the encounter.advertisementWhen police scanned the CCTV footage of Umesh Pal murder, it was revealed that the assailants came in a Creta car and two bikes. The video shows Umesh Pal and one of his two police bodyguards getting down from the SUV when suddenly a man comes from behind and shoots him.Prayagraj Commissioner of Police, Ramit Sharma, said the car was being driven by Arbaaz at the time of Umesh Pal's murder.ALSO READ | Accused in Umesh Pal murder case killed in encounterPolice have detained over 40 people in connection with the Umesh Pal murder case, including Atiq's relatives. The Uttar Pradesh Police are all set to question Atiq Khan, who is currently lodged in Ahmedabad's Sabarmati jail, as they believe he hatched the conspiracy to kill Umesh Pal.Over 100 criminal cases, including murder, robbery, kidnapping, extortion and illegal arms deals, have been registered against Atiq Ahmed. (With inputs from Santosh Sharma)ALSO READ | Atiq Ahmed's kin among 40 held in Umesh Pal murder case; slain MLA's wife makes sensational claim

Luxury River Cruise Reaches Assam's Dibrugarh, Completes 50-Day Journey
NDTVहिंदी न्यूज़BUSINESSMOVIESCRICKETTECHFOODLIFESTYLEHEALTHAUTOCROSSWORDBig BonusSWASTHSHOPPINGLIVE TV LATEST INDIA Elections VIDEO OPINION CITIES WORLD Education OFFBEAT TRENDS FeatureSOUTHPEOPLESciencePhotosWEATHERTV ScheduleTrainsLuxury River Cruise Reaches Assam's Dibrugarh, Completes 50-Day JourneySearch
            ​				                HomeIndia NewsLuxury River Cruise Reaches Assam's Dibrugarh, Completes 50-Day Journey Luxury River Cruise Reaches Assam's Dibrugarh, Completes 50-Day Journey  On January 13, Prime Minister Narendra Modi flagged off the cruise from Varanasi. India NewsPress Trust of IndiaUpdated: February 28, 2023 6:18 pm ISTThe maiden voyage had 32 tourists from Switzerland signing up for the entire journey.Dibrugarh: The world's longest river cruise MV Ganga Vilas on Tuesday reached Dibrugarh, concluding its 50-day river journey that began from Varanasi in Uttar Pradesh.On January 13, Prime Minister Narendra Modi flagged off the cruise from Varanasi.During its journey, the cruise crossed 5 states namely Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, Jharkhand, West Bengal and Assam. It entered Assam on February 17 via Dhaka, Bangladesh. Ganga Vilas covered 3,200 kilometre across 27 river systems.During the journey, the onboard tourists visited 50 tourist spots including world heritage sites, national parks, river ghats, and major cities like Patna in Bihar, Sahibganj in Jharkhand, Kolkata in West Bengal, Dhaka in Bangladesh and Guwahati in Assam.The tourists, including from Switzerland, of the cruise were welcomed by Union Minister of Ports, Shipping and Waterways Sarbananda Sonowal along with Shripad Yesso Naik, Minister of State for Ports, Shipping and Waterways, Rameshwar Teli, MoS Labour and Employment, Petroleum and Natural Gas.According to an official statement, the luxury cruise has three decks, 18 suites onboard with a capacity of 36 tourists.PromotedListen to the latest songs, only on JioSaavn.comThe maiden voyage had 32 tourists from Switzerland signing up for the entire journey, it added.(Except for the headline, this story has not been edited by NDTV staff and is published from a syndicated feed.)Featured Video Of The DayPoll Of Exit Polls: BJP To Win Tripura, Nagaland, Third In MeghalayaTrack Latest News Live on NDTV.com and get news updates from India  and around the world. text: Honda Activa H-Smart: Could 2023 Honda Activa’s smart-key feature turn into a complete failure? Pros and Cons explained - Times of IndiaTop SearchesHonda Activa H-SmartCitroen eC3 vs Tata Tigor EVUpcoming cars SUVs2023 Yamaha YZF R15SUVs with largest alloy wheelsHonda City faceliftEditionININUSSign InTOIAutoBikesVideosNewsCarsElectric CarElectric BikeProduct & PolicyLaunchesReviewsAdvice centreCommercial vehiclesMotorsportsFaceoffsWeb StoriesNewsAuto NewsBikes NewsCould 2023 Honda Activa’s smart-key feature turn into a complete failure? Pros and Cons explainedCould 2023 Honda Activa’s smart-key feature turn into a complete failure? Pros and Cons explainedAmber Banerjee / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Feb 28, 2023, 19:10 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeARTICLESCould 2023 Honda Activa’s smart-key feature turn into a complete failure? Pros and Cons explainedBought an EV? Now protect the EV with electric vehicle Insurance2023 Triumph Street Triple 765 range launch next month: Booking amount, specs, featuresHonda CB350 cafe racer India launch soon: Specs, features, expected priceHonda Motorcycle and Scooter India (HMSI) recently launched the 2023 Honda Activa 6G with a top-end variant, called the ‘H-Smart’. The newly introduced H-Smart sits at the top of the Activa line-up mainly because it offers a car-like Smart Key that enables features such as vehicle location, smart lock-unlock and start-stop. However, the sequence in which the key is operated and the scooter is turned on, seems to be off-putting for several TOI Auto readers. First, lets take a look at the 2023 Honda Activa H-Smart start-up sequence.2023 Honda Activa 6G, How to operate H-Smart Key | TOI AutoSo as we just saw, to operate the H-Smart system, we first need to unlock the scooter by pressing on the key fob button for approximately 5 seconds, once the green light comes on the key fob, the scooter is ready to be started. After this point, a user has to rotate the ignition dial onboard the scooter to the on position, after which, we pull on the left brake handle and press the ignition button to make the scooter come to life. The startup sequence can be perceived to be cumbersome and TOI Auto followers seem to share the same opinion, based on the comments that have been left on a short video shared on our social platforms. One user asked, “This has only increased the time to start! How is it better?”, another said, “Why does it remind me of a washing machine.” One user even took a shot at Honda by saying, “All new Prestige Activa Burner with laughing and heart emoji - seriously regulator?”.2023 Activa smart key and knobThe one big con:So with the 2023 Activa’s current H-Smart system, the cons seem to be quite clear. The system has turned the sequence of hopping on to your scooter, turning a key and riding off a bit more complicated. One would now have to strategically unlock the scooter which only reads the key within 2 metres of proximity and then make an added effort before starting a journey. Ultimately, it relies on changing user behaviour which is not an easy thing to do in the grander scale of things.Screenshots from Instagram/timesofindia.autoThe pros:However, the H-Smart technology is undoubtedly the beginning of next generation smart and safety features in the economical scooter segment. It offers segment-first features such as Smart Find, that allows a scooter to be located when within range via an audible alert. Smart Safe anti-theft system that will not allow ignition unless the key is within 2 metres of the scooter and then there is the added layer of security with the remote based smart on-off and lock-unlock.2023 Honda Activa H-SmartIn the end, like any new technology, Honda’s H-Smart system can be expected to become more sophisticated and streamlined over time. While the added security may feel cumbersome at first, it does go a long way in protecting your investment of Rs 80,537 ex-showroom that one has to pay for the top-end model. Ultimately, what a buyer will have to decide is wether a quick unlock sequence is more important than an added layer of security for their scooter. What will you prefer? Tell us in the comments. Edited By:  Zee Media Bureau|Last Updated: Feb 28, 2023, 01:03 PM IST|Source: ANI ×Trending Photos7Shardul ThakurShardul Thakur, Mittali Parulkar's Wedding: India All-Rounder Shares BEAUTIFUL Photos From Dreamy Wedding - Check6EntertainmentJackky Bhagnani Hosts Party For Singer CKay; Rumoured Couple Ananya Panday-Aditya Roy Kapur Attend: In Pics 6SportsLionel Messi Wins FIFA Award For 7th Time: Check TOP Achievements, in PICS12EntertainmentHoroscope Today, February 28 by Astro Sundeep Kochar: Stop Being Jealous, AquariusMumbai: The ongoing investigation into the suicide of an 18-year-old IIT-Bombay student, who jumped to her death from her hostel`s seventh floor on February 12, was transferred to Special Investigation Team (SIT), Mumbai Crime Branch on Monday. The probe will be led by Lakhmi Gautam, joint commissioner of police, Mumbai Crime Branch. Deputy Commissioner of Police (Crime Branch) Krishnakant Upadhyay and Assistant Commissioner of Police Jai Prakash Bhosale are also part of the team, Mumbai Police said.

"The suicide case of an 18-year-old student of IIT Bombay transferred to SIT Crime Branch. Jt Commissioner of Police (crime) Lakhmi Gautam to lead the team. The student had jumped off the 7th floor of his hostel earlier this month. His family had alleged caste-based harassment," Mumbai Police said in a statement. On February 12, the student, identified as 18-year-old Darshan Solanki jumped to his death from the seventh floor of his hostel.

Powai police registered an Accidental Death Report (ADR) in the matter and launched further investigation. Hailing from Ahmedabad, Darshan was pursuing BTech at the IIT Bombay in Mumbai. As soon as the information about the suicide was received, the police reached the spot and took him to the hospital where the doctors declared him dead. On February 13, Darshan`s family claimed that he faced caste discrimination at IIT Bombay and they suspected some foul play behind his death. Later, his family demanded a probe by a Special Investigation Team (SIT).

On the day Darshan died, IIT Bombay issued a statement strongly refuting news reports that said the first-year B-Tech student was subjected to caste discrimination."It is wrong to make such accusations when the police are still investigating the case. Based on initial inputs from friends, there is no indication that the student faced any such discrimination. We request that such unfounded allegations not be spread," the institute said in the statement. Solanki, Darshan`s father, speaking to ANI, claimed that his son could not have taken his own life.
"He must have been harassed and I fear that he was killed," he added. He alleged that darshan had complained about caste discrimination, but no one paid heed. Darshan`s sister Jahnvi also said the family is "100 percent sure that he was murdered"."First, they told us that Darshan met with an accident When our relatives reached Mumbai, they were told that he fell down the stairs. Later, we were told that he jumped off the 7th floor of his hostel.

How can there be three different versions of his death?" Jahnvi said. She said some students might have hit him on the head, which resulted in his death."We are 100 percent sure he was murdered," she said, claiming that the police and the IIT Bombay management were making up a suicide story to shield the culprits. Live TvIIT Bombayiit bombay accidentAccident newsaccidental death reportfoul playMore Stories Manish Sisodia Quits Sisodia Resigns As Delhi Deputy CM, Satyendar Jain Too Quits As Minister Bill Gates Bill Gates Visits RBI HQ In Mumbai; Meets Governor ShaktiKanta Das  Gurugram Men Riding Luxury Car Allegedly Steal Flower Pots From G20 Event in Gurugram snap Snap Joins AI Race; Announces To Integrate OpenAI's ChatGPT With Platform manish sisodia arrest Delhi Excise Policy Case: Manish Sisodia Resigns As Deputy Delhi CM India vs Australia 2023 LIVE Updates | IND VS AUS 3rd Test, Day 1 Cricket Match Live Score Ben stokes I’m Not Going To Lie...: Ben Stokes Opens Up On His Availability For CSK KL Rahul Rohit Sharma REVEALS Real Reason Behind Removing KL Rahul As Vice CaptainComments - Join the DiscussionTrending newsDNA VideoDNA: Famous writer Anant Pai passed away on this day in the year 2011DNA VideoDNA: For the first time in the year 1886, Aluminum was made in the laboratoryDNA VideoDNA: When India's first education minister Abul Kalam Azad died in 1958DNA VideoDNA: When will the Russia-Ukraine war end?DNA VideoDNA: Fear of corona infection, Home becomes 'Jail'

Have summoned Assembly, Punjab Governor tells Supreme Court amid tussle with AAP govt - India Today India TodayDailyOIndiaTodayNEMalayalamBusiness TodayAaj TakLallantopBanglaGNTTViChowkReader’s DigestSports TakCrime TakAstro TakGamingHarper's BazaarBrides TodayCosmopolitanIshq FMAaj Tak CampusKisan TakMagazineLIVELive TVSearchSEARCHTRENDING TOPICSSIGN INDark ModeHomePersonaliseLive TVIndiaWorldBusinessTechnologyShowbuzzSportsScienceHealthNews AnalysisHappiness QuestMagazineTrendingNewsMoVideosLifestyleEnvironmentEducationLaw TodayAutoCitiesCrimePodcastsOpinionHoroscopesWeatherInteractivesVisual StoriesCryptoFact CheckDIUPhotosCode of EthicsNewsNewsIndiaHave summoned Assembly, Punjab Governor tells SC amid tussle with AAP govtHave summoned Assembly, Punjab Governor tells Supreme Court amid tussle with AAP govtA counsel for Punjab Governor Banwarilal Purohit told the Supreme Court on Tuesday that the Governor had summoned the Assembly for the budget session on March 3. The AAP government in Punjab had moved the Supreme Court after the Governor said he would seek legal advice over the summoning of the Assembly.  AdvertisementIndia Today News DeskNew Delhi,UPDATED: Feb 28, 2023 19:34 ISTThe AAP government led by CM Bhagwant Mann has had a series of run-ins with Governor Banwarilal Purohit.By India Today News Desk: After a standoff with the state government, Punjab Governor Banwarilal Purohit told the Supreme Court on Tuesday that he had summoned the Assembly on March 3 for the budget session. The tussle between the Punjab government and the Governor on summoning of the budget session had reached the Supreme Court on Monday. The Supreme Court said the governor had no discretion to delay the summoning of the state Assembly in contravention of the advice of ministers headed by the chief minister.advertisementThe Supreme Court disposed of the plea and told the state government and the governor that constitutional discourse has to be conducted with a "sense of decorum and mature statesmanship"."While this court is cognisant of free speech and expression, constitutional discourse has to be conducted with a sense of decorum and mature statesmanship, particularly in the context of constitutional dialogue between functionaries," a bench led by Chief Justice DY Chandrachud said. The Supreme Court bench took note of the submission of Solicitor General Tushar Mehta, appearing for Governor Banwarlial Purohit, that the plea of the Punjab government became infructuous in view of the Governor's decision to convene the Assembly.Through Additional Advocate General Shadan Farasat, the AAP government in Punjab approached the Supreme Court on Monday by moving a writ petition under Article 32 of the Constitution. The Punjab government appealed to the Supreme Court to issue directions to the principal secretary of Governor to summon the budget session that is scheduled for March 3. ALSO READ: Tussle between Governor and Punjab govt over budget session reaches Supreme CourtThe Punjab government had also appealed to the Supreme Court to issue a declaration that the governor was bound to act on the aid and advice of the council of ministers in regard to summoning of assembly sessions.Last week, governor Banwarilal Purohit refused to summon the budget session, saying that he wanted legal advice on Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann's "extremely derogatory and patently unconstitutional tweets".The Supreme Court also expressed its displeasure over Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann's derogatory tweet.Senior advocate AM Singhvi, appearing for the Punjab government, alleged that Governor Banwarilal Purohit was hijacking the Constitution. "A constitutional authority is acting in ignorance of the Constitution. He is hijacking the Constitution," Singhvi said.Solicitor General Tushar Mehta told the Supreme Court that the plea filed by the Punjab government had become infructuous. "The governor never refused (to summon the Assembly) and he said he is taking legal advice," Mehta said."Political differences in a democratic polity are acceptable and have to be worked out with sobriety. Unless these principles were borne in mind, the effective implementation of constitutional values is liable to be placed in jeopardy," the Supreme Court bench said.--- ENDS ---

text:
Arrested AAP Ministers Manish Sisodia, Satyendar Jain Quit Delhi Cabinet
NDTVहिंदी न्यूज़BUSINESSMOVIESCRICKETTECHFOODLIFESTYLEHEALTHAUTOCROSSWORDBig BonusSWASTHSHOPPINGLIVE TV LATEST INDIA Elections VIDEO OPINION CITIES WORLD Education OFFBEAT TRENDS FeatureSOUTHPEOPLESciencePhotosWEATHERTV ScheduleTrainsArrested AAP Ministers Manish Sisodia, Satyendar Jain Quit Delhi CabinetSearch
            ​				                HomeIndia NewsArrested AAP Ministers Manish Sisodia, Satyendar Jain Quit Delhi Cabinet Arrested AAP Ministers Manish Sisodia, Satyendar Jain Quit Delhi Cabinet  Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has accepted their resignation and may soon carry out a cabinet shuffle to bring in new ministers. India NewsReported by Sunil PrabhuUpdated: February 28, 2023 7:30 pm ISTThere are now five ministers in the Delhi cabinet, including Arvind Kejriwal.New Delhi: Manish Sisodia and Satyendar Jain, arrested Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) ministers, quit the Delhi cabinet today. Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal accepted their resignations and reassigned their ministries.The resignations were not an acceptance of guilt in any way, AAP asserted, describing it as an "administrative step". No new ministers will join the cabinet, party sources said, at least till the Delhi Budget next month.Manish Sisodia's departments were assigned to ministers Kailash Gahlot and Raj Kumar Anand.Manish Sisodia was arrested on Sunday over allegations of corruption in the Delhi liquor policy case. Before his arrest, he predicted that he would be in jail for "7-8 months"."I am stepping away till the charges against me are proven false," Mr Sisodia wrote in his resignation letter, sent shortly after the Supreme Court refused to entertain his petition challenging his arrest and urged him to approach a lower court first."There are likely to be more cases against me... God knows these allegations are false."The Deputy Chief Minister of Delhi had been in charge of 18 ministries, including the health portfolio of Satyendar Jain, who has been in jail for 10 months. Mr Sisodia said he had served Delhi for eight years "with full dedication".The resignations came soon after the BJP questioned why the arrested ministers were still in the Delhi government.There are now five ministers in the Delhi cabinet, including Mr Kejriwal, who has not taken any ministry, preferring instead to pursue AAP's national plans.Mr Sisodia, widely seen to be Mr Kejriwal's number two in the party and the government, had taken charge of a bulk of the ministries, leaving the AAP chief free to focus on the party's campaign across the country.When Satyendar Jain was arrested in May over allegations of money laundering, Mr Kejriwal simply transferred his departments to Mr Sisodia. Mr Jain held on to his job despite being in jail.But AAP sources said with Mr Sisodia's arrest the Delhi government has a vacuum in key portfolios like finance, health and education.PromotedListen to the latest songs, only on JioSaavn.comMr Kejriwal may be forced to cut back on his trips to other states and take charge of some ministries. It is a huge setback for AAP as it preps for the 2024 national election. The Chief Minister had reportedly planned to visit states like Rajasthan and Madhya Pradesh, where elections will be held later this year.As for Delhi, it will need a Finance Minister to present the budget.Also ReadRead Manish Sisodia's Resignation Letter To Arvind Kejriwal"Stepping Away Till...," Writes Manish Sisodia In Resignation LetterManish Sisodia's 18 Departments To Be Distributed Among These 2 MinistersTrack Latest News Live on NDTV.com and get news updates from India  and around the world. Now protect the EV with electric vehicle InsuranceJ&K: Terrorist who shot dead Kashmiri Pandit in Pulwama eliminated in encounterIndia creating modern digital infrastructure, ensuring benefits of digital revolution reach all: PM ModiNEW DELHI: NEW DELHI: China on Tuesday confirmed that its foreign minister Qin Gang will be visiting India on the sidelines of the G20 Foreign Ministers' Meeting in March. During a press briefing, Mao Ning, an official in the Chinese foreign ministry said - "The G20 should focus on prominent challenges in the global economy. China stands ready to work with all parties to ensure the G20 foreign ministers' meeting sends a positive signal on multilateralism."The Chinese foreign minister's visit comes just days after India said it will send a strong message to the Chinese government warning them over increased aggression at the LAC.Union external minister S Jaishankar is expected to have a bilateral meeting with his Chinese counterpart at the meet, during which the Chinese minister will be given a clear message that the normal relations between India and China cannot be restored without peace, tranquility and normalcy at LAC.His visit to India will be the first by the Chinese foreign minister after his predecessor Wang Yi's visit to New Delhi in 2019.Notably, the relations between the two countries soured ever since the eastern Ladakh military standoff between the two countries in May 2020.India and China have held 17 high-level military commanders talks to resolve the standoff.G20 Foreign Ministers MeetingThe G20 Foreign Ministers Meeting will take place in physical format from March 1-2, 2023 in Delhi under India's presidency.India assumed the Presidency of the G20 on December 1, last year.PM Modi is expected to deliver an address to the foreign ministers of the member countries of G20. He is also likely to speak on India's growing influence globally at the meet.The global meeting of the foreign ministers comes days after a meeting of finance chiefs of the bloc in Bengaluru.The G20 members countries include Argentina, Australia, Brazil, Canada, China, France, Germany, India, Indonesia, Italy, Japan, South Korea, Mexico, Russia, Saudi Arabia, South Africa, Turkey, the UK, and the 'Election Chuna Lagao Aayog': Uddhav Thackeray's Swipe At EC After Losing Shiv Sena Name, Symbol To Eknath Shinde | India News | Zee Newsहिन्दीEnglishमराठीবাংলাதமிழ்മലയാളംગુજરાતીతెలుగుಕನ್ನಡBusinessTechWorldHealthNEWSVIDEOSPHOTOSWeb StoriesLogoutSign InLogoutGOHomeLive TVWomen Achievers AwardsLatest NewsIndiaAhmedabadBengaluruChennaiHyderabadKolkataMumbaiPuneMY MONEYCricketEntertainmentHollywoodMusicBollywoodTelevisionRegionalMovie ReviewSportsFootballTennisBadmintonOther SportsLifestyleRelationshipTravelFood & RecipesFashionCultureSpiritualityBusinessEconomyMarketsCompaniesReal EstateInternational BusinessPersonal FinanceAutomobileWorldAsiaAfricaAmericasAustralia-OceaniaEuropeMobilityViral newsDiabytesTechnologyGadgetGamingInternet & Social MediaAppsMobileLive TVWomen Achievers AwardsLatest NewsIndiaMY MONEYCricketEntertainmentSportsLifestyleBusinessWorldMobilityViral newsDiabytesHomeLive TVWomen Achievers AwardsLatest NewsIndiaMY MONEYCricketEntertainmentSportsLifestyleBusinessWorldMobilityViral newsDiabytesTechnologyXtopStoriesenglish2577902NewsIndiaUDDHAV THACKERAY'Election Chuna Lagao Aayog': Uddhav Thackeray's Swipe At EC After Losing Shiv Sena Name, Symbol To Eknath ShindeUddhav Thackeray's reaction came days after the Election Commission (EC) declared that the party faction led by Eknath Shinde is the real Shiv Sena. 
Written By  Zee Media Bureau|Last Updated: Feb 28, 2023, 12:58 PM IST|Source: Bureau ×Trending Photos7Shardul ThakurShardul Thakur, Mittali Parulkar's Wedding: India All-Rounder Shares BEAUTIFUL Photos From Dreamy Wedding - Check6EntertainmentJackky Bhagnani Hosts Party For Singer CKay; Rumoured Couple Ananya Panday-Aditya Roy Kapur Attend: In Pics 6SportsLionel Messi Wins FIFA Award For 7th Time: Check TOP Achievements, in PICS12EntertainmentHoroscope Today, February 28 by Astro Sundeep Kochar: Stop Being Jealous, AquariusNew Delhi: Days after the Election Commission (EC) declared that the party faction led by Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde is the real Shiv Sena and allotted it the 'bow and arrow' symbol, Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Uddhav Thackeray on Monday (February 27, 2023) said he no longer had trust in the apex poll body. The former Maharashtra CM also said that the EC should be called "Election Chuna Lagao Aayog". 

"The Election Commission is bogus. It should be called the 'Election Chuna Lagao Aayog'. We have lost trust in it," Thackeray said at a party event on the occasion of Marathi Language Day.


आज बिर्ला मातोश्री सभागृह,मुंबई येथे स्थानीय लोकाधिकार समिती महासंघाच्या सुवर्णमहोत्सवी वर्षानिमित्त मराठी भाषा गौरव दिनी आयोजित 'मराठी भाषा दिवस' कार्यक्रम संपन्न झाला. या कार्यक्रमात पक्षप्रमुख श्री. उद्धवसाहेब ठाकरे यांनी उपस्थितांशी संवाद साधला. pic.twitter.com/ySniMN0TLl
— ShivSena - शिवसेना Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray (@ShivSenaUBT_) February 27, 2023

The Shiv Sena (UBT) leader stated that the poll body should not have given its decision on the party name and symbol when hearings connected to it were underway in the Supreme Court.

He said the EC had given a symbol each to Rashtriya Lok Janshakti Party factions headed by party founder late Ram Vilas Paswan's son Chirag and Paswan's brother Pashupati Kumar Paras in a dispute similar to the one in the Shiv Sena. 

However, both factions are quiet over it as they are with the ruling Bharatiya Janta Party (BJP), Thackeray added.

Eknath Shinde and his supporters are 'creepers': Uddhav Thackeray 
Uddhav Thackeray also attacked Eknath Shinde and his supporters and said that they were "creepers" who had started thinking of themselves as the host tree.
Those who don't have values resort to stealing, Thackeray said in an apparent dig at the Shinde group.

Shinde had rebelled against Thackeray in June last year, which split the Shiv Sena and brought down the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government, which also comprised Sharad Pawar's Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) and the Congress.

Meanwhile, Shiv Sena (UBT) leader and Lok Sabha MP Rajan Vichare on Monday said that functionaries of the Eknath Shinde-led faction had usurped a 'shakha' (local office) that had been for running in Thane for several years when the party was undivided.

Despite an undertaking in the Supreme Court and public statements by Chief Minister Shinde that he or his supporters are not keen to lay claim on Sena properties, 'shakhas' were being grabbed, Vichare alleged.
The Lokmanya Nagar 'shakha' has been taken over by Shinde's supporters by force, he claimed.

Since the EC -- earlier this month -- recognised the Shinde group as the real Shiv Sena, there has been speculation over the ownership of the undivided party's properties, including the local offices where the cadre assemble through the day.Live TvUddhav ThackerayECEknath ShindeShiv SenaElection CommissionMore Stories Manish Sisodia Quits Sisodia Resigns As Delhi Deputy CM, Satyendar Jain Too Quits As Minister Bill Gates Bill Gates Visits RBI HQ In Mumbai; Meets Governor ShaktiKanta Das  Gurugram Men Riding Luxury Car Allegedly Steal Flower Pots From G20 Event in Gurugram snap Snap Joins AI Race; Announces To Integrate OpenAI's ChatGPT With Platform manish sisodia arrest Delhi Excise Policy Case: Manish Sisodia Resigns As Deputy Delhi CM India vs Australia 2023 LIVE Updates | IND VS AUS 3rd Test, Day 1 Cricket Match Live Score Ben stokes I’m Not Going To Lie...: Ben Stokes Opens Up On His Availability For CSK KL Rahul Rohit Sharma REVEALS Real Reason Behind Removing KL Rahul As Vice CaptainComments - Join the DiscussionTrending newsDNA VideoDNA: Famous writer Anant Pai passed away on this day in the year 2011DNA VideoDNA: For the first time in the year 1886, Aluminum was made in the laboratoryDNA VideoDNA: When India's first education minister Abul Kalam Azad died in 1958DNA VideoDNA: When will the Russia-Ukraine war end?DNA VideoDNA: Fear of corona infection, Home becomes 'Jail'

text:
Umesh Pal murder: As pic of accused with Akhilesh Yadav goes viral, BJP, SP engage in photo war - India Today India TodayDailyOIndiaTodayNEMalayalamBusiness TodayAaj TakLallantopBanglaGNTTViChowkReader’s DigestSports TakCrime TakAstro TakGamingHarper's BazaarBrides TodayCosmopolitanIshq FMAaj Tak CampusKisan TakMagazineLIVELive TVSearchSEARCHTRENDING TOPICSSIGN INDark ModeHomePersonaliseLive TVIndiaWorldBusinessTechnologyShowbuzzSportsScienceHealthNews AnalysisHappiness QuestMagazineTrendingNewsMoVideosLifestyleEnvironmentEducationLaw TodayAutoCitiesCrimePodcastsOpinionHoroscopesWeatherInteractivesVisual StoriesCryptoFact CheckDIUPhotosCode of EthicsNewsNewsIndiaAs pic of accused with Akhilesh Yadav goes viral, BJP, SP engage in photo warUmesh Pal murder: As pic of accused with Akhilesh Yadav goes viral, BJP, SP engage in photo warThe BJP and SP engaged in a photo war after an image of one of the accused in Umesh Pal's murder, Sadaqat Khan with Akhilesh Yadav, went viral.  AdvertisementIndia Today News DeskNew Delhi,UPDATED: Feb 28, 2023 14:45 ISTPhotos of SP chief Akhilesh Yadav with Sadaqat Khan, one of the conspirators in Umesh Pal murder. (Image: Twitter) By India Today News Desk: In another development in the Umesh Pal murder case, photos of Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav with Sadaqat Khan, one of the conspirators in Pal's murder, have surfaced on social media.Sharing the photos, UP Congress on Twitter wrote in Hindi, “Be it BJP or SP. If both are involved in holding the finger (hand) of criminals, then they are two sides of the same coin."

à¤¦à¥‡à¤–à¤¿à¤¯à¥‡! à¤‰à¤®à¥‡à¤¶ à¤ªà¤¾à¤² à¤¹à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤•à¤¾à¤‚à¤¡ à¤•à¤¾ à¤®à¥à¤–à¥à¤¯ à¤¸à¤¾à¤œà¤¿à¤¶à¤•à¤°à¥à¤¤à¤¾ à¤¸à¤¦à¤¾à¤•à¤¤ à¤–à¤¾à¤¨ à¤ªà¥‚à¤°à¥à¤µ à¤®à¥à¤–à¥à¤¯à¤®à¤‚à¤¤à¥à¤°à¥€ à¤•à¥‡ à¤¸à¤¾à¤¥ à¤•à¥ˆà¤¸à¥‡ à¤¸à¥€à¤¨à¤¾ à¤¤à¤¾à¤¨à¥‡ à¤–à¤¡à¤¼à¤¾ à¤¹à¥ˆà¥¤
à¤­à¤¾à¤œà¤ªà¤¾ à¤¹à¥‹ à¤¯à¤¾ à¤¸à¤ªà¤¾à¥¤ à¤…à¤ªà¤°à¤¾à¤§à¤¿à¤¯à¥‹à¤‚ à¤•à¥€ à¤‰à¤‚à¤—à¤²à¥€ à¤¥à¤¾à¤®à¤¨à¥‡ à¤®à¥‡à¤‚ à¤¦à¥‹à¤¨à¥‹à¤‚ à¤¹à¥ˆà¤‚ à¤¤à¥‹ à¤à¤• à¤¹à¥€ à¤¸à¤¿à¤•à¥à¤•à¥‡ à¤•à¥‡ à¤¦à¥‹ à¤ªà¤¹à¤²à¥‚à¥¤ pic.twitter.com/Fn02bdOk35
— UP Congress (@INCUttarPradesh) February 28, 2023
advertisementUmesh Pal was a key witness in the 2005 murder case of BSP MLA Raju Pal and was shot dead by assailants on February 24 outside his home in the Dhoomanganj area of Prayagraj.A political slugfest broke out between the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and Samajwadi Party (SP) over the public killing of Umesh Pal. ALSO READ | Accused in Umesh Pal murder case killed in encounterCalling the Samajwadi Party a "nursery of criminals", Uttar Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Brajesh Pathak said that the government has zero tolerance against crime."Our government has zero tolerance against crime. The whole state knows that the Samajwadi Party is a nursery of criminals. But we are committed to ensure that no matter what reach or clout any criminal has, we will not spare that person," Pathak said.Responding to the photo, Akhilesh Yadav said that anyone can come up and get a photo clicked with a public official."One can get a photo clicked with anyone. Yesterday, the CM and I had a photo together. It's the age of social media , anyone comes and gets a photo clicked," he told the media.Meanwhile, the SP also shared an image of Sadaqat Khan with former BJP MLA Udaybhan Karwariya.

à¤¸à¤¦à¤¾à¤•à¤¤ à¤µà¤°à¥à¤¤à¤®à¤¾à¤¨ à¤®à¥‡à¤‚ BJP à¤•à¤¾ à¤¸à¤¦à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤¥à¤¾ à¤œà¤¿à¤¸à¤•à¥€ à¤«à¥‹à¤Ÿà¥‹ à¤¸à¤ªà¤¾ à¤•à¥‡ à¤¸à¤¾à¤¥ à¤œà¥‹à¤¡à¤¼à¥€ à¤œà¤¾ à¤°à¤¹à¥€
BJP à¤•à¥€ à¤ªà¥‚à¤°à¥à¤µ à¤µà¤¿à¤§à¤¾à¤¯à¤¿à¤•à¤¾ à¤¨à¥€à¤²à¤® à¤•à¤°à¤µà¤°à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾ à¤•à¥‡ à¤˜à¤° à¤ªà¤° à¤¨à¥€à¤²à¤® à¤•à¥‡ à¤ªà¤¤à¤¿ à¤‰à¤¦à¤¯à¤­à¤¾à¤¨ à¤•à¤°à¤µà¤°à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾ à¤•à¥‡ à¤¸à¤¾à¤¥ à¤¸à¤¦à¤¾à¤•à¤¤ à¤•à¥€ à¤«à¥‹à¤Ÿà¥‹ BJP à¤•à¥‡ à¤¸à¤¾à¤¥ à¤‡à¤¸ à¤˜à¤Ÿà¤¨à¤¾à¤•à¥à¤°à¤® à¤•à¤¾ à¤•à¤¨à¥‡à¤•à¥à¤¶à¤¨ à¤¬à¤¤à¤¾à¤¤à¥€ à¤¹à¥ˆà¤‚
à¤‡à¤¸à¤¸à¥‡ à¤ªà¤¹à¤²à¥‡ à¤­à¥€ à¤à¤• BJP à¤¨à¥‡à¤¤à¤¾ à¤°à¤¾à¤¹à¤¿à¤² à¤‡à¤¸ à¤•à¥‡à¤¸ à¤•à¤¾ à¤®à¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤Ÿà¤°à¤®à¤¾à¤‡à¤‚à¤¡ à¤ªà¤•à¤¡à¤¼à¤¾ à¤œà¤¾ à¤šà¥à¤•à¤¾ à¤¹à¥ˆ
1/2 pic.twitter.com/lU87A1ZvJQ
— SamajwadiPartyMediaCell (@MediaCellSP) February 28, 2023
The media cell of the party took to Twitter to share the image and wrote, "Sadaqat is currently a member of BJP whose photo is being linked with SP. Sadaqat's photo with Neelam's husband Udaybhan Karwariya at former BJP MLA Neelam Karwariya's house shows the connection of this incident with BJP. Before this, a BJP leader Rahil, the mastermind of this case, was caught."The conspiracy to kill Umesh Pal was planned at the Bareilly jail in Uttar Pradesh at the behest of infamous gangster Atiq Ahmed, sources told India Today. Police on Monday disclosed that a meeting of Umesh Pal's shooters also took place in a room of a hostel which belonged to Sadaqat Khan. Khan is one of the key conspirators of the case and has been arrested by UP Police's Special Task Force (STF).advertisementMeanwhile, on Monday, an accused in the Umesh Pal murder case, identified as Arbaz, was killed in an encounter in UP's Prayagraj.ALSO READ | Conspiracy in Bareilly jail, planning in hostel: How accused executed Umesh Pal's murder --- ENDS ---

text:
Shashi Tharoor's Twist To Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Na Khaunga Na Khane Dunga Slogan
NDTVहिंदी न्यूज़BUSINESSMOVIESCRICKETTECHFOODLIFESTYLEHEALTHAUTOCROSSWORDBig BonusSWASTHSHOPPINGLIVE TV LATEST INDIA Elections VIDEO OPINION CITIES WORLD Education OFFBEAT TRENDS FeatureSOUTHPEOPLESciencePhotosWEATHERTV ScheduleTrainsShashi Tharoor's Twist To PM's 'Na Khaunga Na Khane Dunga' SloganSearch
            ​				                HomeIndia NewsShashi Tharoor's Twist To PM's 'Na Khaunga Na Khane Dunga' Slogan Shashi Tharoor's Twist To PM's 'Na Khaunga Na Khane Dunga' Slogan  Shashi Tharoor's swipe came a day after Delhi Deputy Chief Minister and AAP leader Manish Sisodia was sent to five-day custody of the CBI by a special court in an excise policy scam case after being arrested on Sunday. India NewsPress Trust of IndiaUpdated: February 28, 2023 7:16 pm ISTShashi Thatoor said, "Always wondered about 'na khaunga na khane dunga' meaning" (FILE)New Delhi: Senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday shared a list of leaders against whom graft probes were allegedly stopped after they switched sides to the BJP and took a swipe at Prime Minister Narendra Modi's 'na khaunga na khane dunga' slogan, saying that probably "he was only talking about beef".Mr Tharoor's swipe came a day after Delhi Deputy Chief Minister and AAP leader Manish Sisodia was sent to five-day custody of the CBI by a special court in an excise policy scam case after being arrested on Sunday.Taking to Twitter, he shared a list, widely circulated on social media, of eight leaders -- Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma, former Karnataka chief minister BS Yediyurappa, Suvendu Adhikari, Bhavna Gawli, Yashwant Jadhav, Yamini Jadhav, Pratap Sarnaik and Narayan Rane -- who either joined the BJP or its allies.The screenshot of the list shared by Mr Tharoor claimed that graft probes against these leaders were stalled after they switched sides in support of the BJP.PromotedListen to the latest songs, only on JioSaavn.com"This is going around, so sharing as received. Always wondered about the meaning of 'na khaunga na khane dunga' . I guess he was only talking about beef!" Mr Tharoor said, referring to the anti-graft slogan attributed to Prime Minister Narendra Modi.This is going around, so sharing as received. Always wondered about the meaning of न खाऊँगा न खाने दूँगा. I guess he was only talking about beef! pic.twitter.com/oggXdXX8Ac— Shashi Tharoor (@ShashiTharoor) February 28, 2023The CBI on Sunday evening arrested Mr Sisodia after nearly eight hours of questioning on various aspects of the now scrapped excise policy for 2021-22, which the probe agency says suffered from irregularities both in its formulation and implementation, allegedly intended to benefit people with links to the(Except for the headline, this story has not been edited by NDTV staff and is published from a syndicated feed.)Featured Video Of The DayManish Sisodia Challenges Arrest, CBI's Probe In Supreme CourtAlso Read"Identify 10 Problems That Can Be Solved Using AI": PM ModiAfter 2 Months In Jail, Congress Leader Gets Bail For "Anti Modi" RemarksShivamogga Airport Built At A Cost Of Rs 450 Crore Inaugurated By PM ModiTrack Latest News Live on NDTV.com and get news updates from India  and around the world. text: KL Rahul's removal as vice-captain doesn't indicate anything: Rohit Sharma | Cricket News - Times of IndiaTop SearchesIndia vs AustraliaLionel MessiSachin Tendulkar StatueNew Zealand vs EnglandLahore Qalandars vs Islamabad UnitedIPL ScheduleWPL 2023 ScheduleWomen's World Cup ScheduleWomen's World Cup Points Table 2023CSK IPL 2023 SquadEditionININUSSign InTOIsportsCricketCWG 2022IPLFootballBadmintonHockeyTennisRacingAthleticsShootingVolleyballChessWWEBoxingGolfSnooker/BilliardsCyclingWrestlingothersICC world test championshipeng vs pakScheduleIPL 2023ResultsNewsSports NewsCricket NewsKL Rahul's removal as vice-captain doesn't indicate anything: Rohit SharmaKL Rahul's removal as vice-captain doesn't indicate anything: Rohit SharmaPTI /  Feb 28, 2023, 14:37 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeARTICLESKL Rahul's removal as vice-captain doesn't indicate anything: Rohit SharmaISB Digital Transformation Programme – Preparing working professionals to make their organisations future-ready3rd Test: Australia batsmen will aim to slow things down in Indore, says Steve SmithNew Test, old headache: Play Shubman Gill or stay with KL Rahul?KL Rahul and Rohit Sharma. (PTI Photo)INDORE: India skipper Rohit Sharma kept the KL Rahul versus Shubman Gill debate open on the eve of the third Test, saying former's removal as vice-captain doesn't indicate anything and the management will continue to back the players with "potential".Rohit and Gill batted in adjacent nets in the optional practice on Tuesday while Rahul chose to stay back in the hotel with the majority of the squad.Both Gill and Rahul had batted simultaneously during the training session on Monday.Rahul averages an underwhelming 33.4 after 47 Tests while Gill has been waiting patiently for his opportunity in red-ball cricket after a sensational season in limited overs cricket.Rahul, who has failed to cross the 25-run mark in his last 10 Test innings, was removed as vice-captain following the second Test in Delhi, raising hopes of a change for the remaining two games.Rohit kept the suspense going till the very end."I spoke about it after the last game as well. Players who are going through a tough time, given their potential they will be given enough time to prove themselves," Rohit said in a media interaction."Being vice-captain or otherwise doesn't tell you anything. At that point in time he was the vice-captain. His removal as vice-captain doesn't indicate anything."https://t.co/3hVeDO2nXD— BCCI (@BCCI) 1677572251000When asked the preparation of both Gill and Rahul, the skipper added: "As far as Gill and KL Rahul are concerned, that is how they train before any game. Today was optional training session for the entire group. Whoever wanted to come they came."As far as 11 is concerned, I would like to do it at the toss. text:
'First Time An Education Minister Will Go To Tihar Jail': Gambhir Slams Sisodia | India News | Zee Newsहिन्दीEnglishमराठीবাংলাதமிழ்മലയാളംગુજરાતીతెలుగుಕನ್ನಡBusinessTechWorldHealthNEWSVIDEOSPHOTOSWeb StoriesLogoutSign InLogoutGOHomeLive TVWomen Achievers AwardsLatest NewsIndiaAhmedabadBengaluruChennaiHyderabadKolkataMumbaiPuneMY MONEYCricketEntertainmentHollywoodMusicBollywoodTelevisionRegionalMovie ReviewSportsFootballTennisBadmintonOther SportsLifestyleRelationshipTravelFood & RecipesFashionCultureSpiritualityBusinessEconomyMarketsCompaniesReal EstateInternational BusinessPersonal FinanceAutomobileWorldAsiaAfricaAmericasAustralia-OceaniaEuropeMobilityViral newsDiabytesTechnologyGadgetGamingInternet & Social MediaAppsMobileLive TVWomen Achievers AwardsLatest NewsIndiaMY MONEYCricketEntertainmentSportsLifestyleBusinessWorldMobilityViral newsDiabytesHomeLive TVWomen Achievers AwardsLatest NewsIndiaMY MONEYCricketEntertainmentSportsLifestyleBusinessWorldMobilityViral newsDiabytesTechnologyXtopStoriesenglish2577934NewsIndiaGAUTAM GAMBHIR'First Time An Education Minister Will Go To Tihar Jail': Gambhir Slams SisodiaDelhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia was arrested by the CBI on Sunday in connection with alleged corruption in the formulation and implementation of the now-scrapped liquor policy.
Written By  Zee Media Bureau|Last Updated: Feb 28, 2023, 12:57 PM IST|Source: Bureau ×Trending Photos7Shardul ThakurShardul Thakur, Mittali Parulkar's Wedding: India All-Rounder Shares BEAUTIFUL Photos From Dreamy Wedding - Check6EntertainmentJackky Bhagnani Hosts Party For Singer CKay; Rumoured Couple Ananya Panday-Aditya Roy Kapur Attend: In Pics 6SportsLionel Messi Wins FIFA Award For 7th Time: Check TOP Achievements, in PICS12EntertainmentHoroscope Today, February 28 by Astro Sundeep Kochar: Stop Being Jealous, AquariusNew Delhi: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) MP Gautam Gambhir on Tuesday (February 28, 2023) launched a scathing attack on Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia, who has been arrested in the Delhi excise policy scam case, and said that they should get what "they deserve". Speaking to the news agency ANI, Gambhir, a Lok Sabha MP from East Delhi, also said that this is the first time in India that an Education Minister will go to Tihar jail. 

"It was an open-and-shut case. They should get what they deserve. This is the first time in India that an Education Minister will go to Tihar jail, that too in a liquor scam case. This policy was made to exploit money so that they can fight elections with Khalistani's help," Gambhir was quoted as saying by ANI.

"If there was no discrepancy in liquor policy, it shouldn't have been taken back. This is not the time to give emotional statements. If he (Sisodia) has opened schools, colleges, and hospitals, show it to us. He can move to SC, but for me, Delhi CM (Arvind Kejriwal) and AAP have been exposed," the cricketer-turned-politician added.

If there was no discrepancy in liquor policy, it shouldn't have been taken back. This is not the time to give emotional statements. If he (Sisodia) has opened schools, colleges & hospitals, show it to us. He can move to SC, but for me, Delhi CM&AAP has been exposed:Gautam Gambhir pic.twitter.com/RjEAT8oyIE
— ANI (@ANI) February 28, 2023

Earlier in the day, Sisodia moved the Supreme Court seeking bail in the excise policy case.

A bench headed by Chief Justice D Y Chandrachud took note of the submissions of senior advocate A M Singhvi, appearing for Sisodia who is presently in CBI's custody, and agreed to hear the plea today itself at 3.50 PM.

The top court initially observed that the jailed Aam Aadmi Party leader has remedies under the Code of Criminal Procedure (CrPC) to move the Delhi High Court for bail and seeking the quashing of the FIR.
A special Delhi court on Monday sent Sisodia to five-day CBI remand in the excise policy case to allow the agency to get "genuine and legitimate" answers to questions being put to him for "a proper and fair investigation".

The CBI on Sunday evening had arrested Sisodia in connection with alleged corruption in the formulation and implementation of the now-scrapped liquor policy for 2021-22.Live TvGautam GambhirManish SisodiaBJPAAPCBIdelhi excise policy scamMore Stories Manish Sisodia Quits Sisodia Resigns As Delhi Deputy CM, Satyendar Jain Too Quits As Minister Bill Gates Bill Gates Visits RBI HQ In Mumbai; Meets Governor ShaktiKanta Das  Gurugram Men Riding Luxury Car Allegedly Steal Flower Pots From G20 Event in Gurugram snap Snap Joins AI Race; Announces To Integrate OpenAI's ChatGPT With Platform manish sisodia arrest Delhi Excise Policy Case: Manish Sisodia Resigns As Deputy Delhi CM India vs Australia 2023 LIVE Updates | IND VS AUS 3rd Test, Day 1 Cricket Match Live Score Ben stokes I’m Not Going To Lie...: Ben Stokes Opens Up On His Availability For CSK KL Rahul Rohit Sharma REVEALS Real Reason Behind Removing KL Rahul As Vice CaptainComments - Join the DiscussionTrending newsDNA VideoDNA: Famous writer Anant Pai passed away on this day in the year 2011DNA VideoDNA: For the first time in the year 1886, Aluminum was made in the laboratoryDNA VideoDNA: When India's first education minister Abul Kalam Azad died in 1958DNA VideoDNA: When will the Russia-Ukraine war end?DNA VideoDNA: Fear of corona infection, Home becomes 'Jail'
