text: World Test Championship Final: Rampaging India eye WTC final spot against down and out Australia | Cricket News - Times of IndiaTop SearchesIndia vs AustraliaLionel MessiSachin Tendulkar StatueNew Zealand vs EnglandLahore Qalandars vs Islamabad UnitedIPL ScheduleWPL 2023 ScheduleWomen's World Cup ScheduleWomen's World Cup Points Table 2023CSK IPL 2023 SquadEditionININUSSign InTOIsportsCricketCWG 2022IPLFootballBadmintonHockeyTennisRacingAthleticsShootingVolleyballChessWWEBoxingGolfSnooker/BilliardsCyclingWrestlingothersICC world test championshipeng vs pakScheduleIPL 2023ResultsNewsSports NewsCricket NewsRampaging India eye WTC final spot against down and out AustraliaRampaging India eye WTC final spot against down and out AustraliaTIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Feb 28, 2023, 14:22 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeARTICLESRampaging India eye WTC final spot against down and out AustraliaISB Digital Transformation Programme – Preparing working professionals to make their organisations future-readyNew Test, old headache: Play Shubman Gill or stay with KL Rahul?India vs Australia: Rohit Sharma's red-ball resolveRahul Dravid and Rohit Sharma inspect the pitch at Holkar Stadium in Indore. (PTI Photo)NEW DELHI: Having already secured the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, India will be looking to enhance their aura of invincibility at home with another series win against an Australian side that will need a monumental effort to bounce back in the third Test, starting in Indore on Wednesday.India will not only be looking for a guaranteed World Test Championship final spot in June, but also for a record-extending 16th straight series win at home.Leading 2-0 in a four-match series, India are sitting pretty and just need to make one tough decision of choosing between out-of-form KL Rahul and Shubman Gill.Rahul is no more the vice-captain of the side but the team management has shown tremendous faith in him and he might well get another opportunity to get back among the runs.The only hundred of the series, which has been dominated by spinners, has come from the bat of Rohit Sharma. If India get to bat on day one, the conditions will be ideal for the likes of Cheteshwar Pujara and Virat Kohli to pile on the runs.The trio of Ravindra Jadeja, R Ashwin and Axar Patel has not just delivered with the ball, it has also scored the bulk of the runs so far in the series. Since they can't be expected to get runs in the lower order regularly, the onus lies on the top-order.Contrary to Australia's inexplicable sweeping tactics, Indian batters have adopted the conventional approach against the impressive Australian spinners.Rohit has been brilliant with his feet movement, Kohli too has looked assured in the middle and an unbeaten 31 from Cheteshwar Pujara in his 100th Test must have made him more confident going into the third Test.The square at the Holkar Stadium houses pitches with both black and red soil. The curators have decided to go with the black soil, which usually doesn't offer as much turn and bounce compared to red soil tracks.Their battered and bruised opponents, Australia, have got a lot of time to reflect on their defeats in Nagpur and Delhi. The debacle in Delhi, where they effectively lost the game in session, should hurt more.In terms of their squad composition, a lot has changed with Pat Cummins back in Australia to be with his ailing mother. Ashton Agar, Josh Hazlewood and David Warner too are back home. Steve Smith will lead the side.The visitors could not be faulted for the amount of effort they are putting in to stage a comeback in the series.They seem ready to shun the inexplicable sweeping tactics they employed in Delhi and are expected to take a more conventional approach to counter the rampaging Ashwin and Jadeja.Such has been their domination that Patel has only got to bowl 26 overs.How the Australians defend against the spinners will be key to their chances here. Runs are always vital but their batters need to bat long. It has to be a mix of caution and aggression as the over attacking style of play is likely to be counter-productive.Travis Head is expected to open alongside Usman Khawaja.Khawaja struck a well-made 81 in Delhi and Head briefly put pressure on the spinners with his aggressive play. Trust Head to continue in the same fashion while Khawaja will be expected to play the waiting game.The fulcrum of their batting, Smith and Labuschagne, average less than 30 so far in the series and without their runs, an Australia fightback will be highly unlikely.All-rounder Cameron Green is fit again alongside Mitchell Starc and both are expected to start on Wednesday. Australia are likely to continue with three specialists spinners in Nathan Lyon, Todd Murphy and Matthew Kuhnemann.Teams (from):India: Rohit Sharma (c), KL Rahul, Shubman Gill, Cheteshwar Pujara, Virat Kohli, Shreyas Iyer, KS Bharat, Ishan Kishan, Ravichandran Ashwin, Axar Patel, Kuldeep Yadav, Ravindra Jadeja, Mohammed Shami, Mohammed Siraj, Umesh Yadav, Suryakumar Yadav, Jaydev UnadkatAustralia: Scott Boland, Alex Carey, Cameron Green, Peter Handscomb, Travis Head, Usman Khawaja, Matt Kuhnemann, Marnus Labuschagne, Nathan Lyon, Lance Morris, Todd Murphy, Matthew Renshaw, Steve Smith (captain), Mitchell Starc, Mitchell Swepson(With PTI inputs)Start a ConversationFOLLOW US ON SOCIAL MEDIAFacebookTwitterInstagramKOO APPYOUTUBE Visual Stories  Diljit Dosanjh's 8-ingredient desi chai is the best way to begin the dayFood10 Bollywood celebs who no longer eat meatLifestyleHot makeup looks of Mrunal ThakurLifestyle11 times Malaika Arora proved she is the queen of fashionEntertainmentAlaya F wows the internet in a stylish bikiniindiaA look at Imlie fame Seerat Kapoor's Cheeni-inspired outfitstvInteresting experiences in Punjab for the traveller in youtravelG20 Summit: Special Haryanvi Menu for foreign delegatesFood10 alluring photos of Amritha AiyerEntertainment123Hockey World CupGraham ReidHockey World CupHockey World Cup 2023Hockey World Cup ScheduleHockey World Cup Points TableHockey World Cup TrophyRourkela Birsa Munda Hockey StadiumTop TrendingExit Polls 2023KL RahulPM Kisan SchemeManish SisodiaMumbai Train AccidentBihar Budget 2023 LiveTrending StoriesIn SportsEntire Website3rd Test: India eye WTC final spot against down and out AustraliaMessi wins FIFA Best prize, Putellas claims women's awardAustralia batsmen will aim to slow things down: SmithWalk down memory lane: The 3 narrowest wins by runs in men's TestsWhat a thriller! text: Hyundai: Top 5 upcoming Honda, Hyundai cars/ SUVs in 2023-24: New City, Verna and more - Times of IndiaTop SearchesCar tyres Number meaning2023 Hyundai VernaMaruti Suzuki Ignis2023 Yamaha YZF R15Miracle GRHonda City faceliftEditionININUSSign InTOIAutoCarsVideosNewsBikesElectric CarElectric BikeProduct & PolicyLaunchesReviewsAdvice centreCommercial vehiclesMotorsportsFaceoffsWeb StoriesNewsAuto NewsCars NewsTop 5 upcoming Honda, Hyundai cars/ SUVs in 2023-24: New City, Verna and moreTop 5 upcoming Honda, Hyundai cars/ SUVs in 2023-24: New City, Verna and moreTIMESOFINDIA.COM /  Feb 28, 2023, 13:21 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeARTICLESTop 5 upcoming Honda, Hyundai cars/ SUVs in 2023-24: New City, Verna and moreISB Digital Transformation Programme – Preparing working professionals to make their organisations future-readyYulu, Bajaj Auto launch two new electric 2-wheelers - Miracle GR and Dex GR2023 Honda City facelift leaked ahead of debut this week: Check out all the changesHyundai’s Ai3 micro SUV will be based on the same platform that underpins the newly launched Grand i10 Nios and the Aura. The Micro SUV is expected to measure around 3.7-3.8 meters in length. In terms of design, the Ai3 gets design cues borrowed from Venue. It features a split headlamp setup.Within just two months into 2023, the Indian automotive Industry witnessed lots of action. Lots of launches and unveils took place at Delhi Auto Expo. Multiple cars and SUVs will now receive updates due to upcoming RDE norms. The coming months will be filled with multiple launches and unveils.In this article, let’s take a look at the top 5 upcoming cars and SUVs from Honda and Hyundai.1. Honda CityHonda Cars India is all set to launch the new and updated Honda City to the Indian market. The sedan was completely revealed by a YouTuber ahead of launch. The new City will get redesigned front bumper with a honeycomb grille. The sedan also gets re-designed 16-inch alloy wheels and the overall silhouette remains the same. At back, the car gets a lip spoiler with an integrated diffuser in the rear bumper.The dashboard layout remains the same as before, it features a dual-tone theme with an 8-inch touchscreen infotainment system with updated UI. The car now gets a semi-digital instrument cluster. Other features include automatic climate control, ventilated seats, an electric sunroof and many more. The new Honda City will get Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS). It gets adaptive cruise control, lane keep assist, collision mitigation braking, road departure mitigation, and auto high beam. Honda calls this Honda sensing and these are already on offer with Honda City e: HEV. Talking about the powertrain, the City will no longer be available diesel powertrains. The sedan gets a 1.5-litre V-TEC petrol engine with 121 PS of power and 145 Nm of torque. Gearbox options include a 6-speed manual and a CVT gearbox. 2. Hyundai VernaHyundai recently revealed that it will be launching the new Verna on March 21 st 2022. The prices for the new Verna are expected to start from Rs 10 lakh (ex-showroom). When launched it will continue to compete with VW Virtus, Skoda Slavia, Honda City and Maruti Ciaz. The new Verna features a connecting split-headlamp setup at the front with a large grille. Moving to the sides, the new Verna gets some strong character lines inspired by Tucson SUV. The sedan is also expected to get 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels. At the rear, the Verna gets connecting tail lamps with an integrated rear diffuser. Talking about the powertrain, the Verna will be offered with two powertrain options - a 1.5-litre NA petrol motor that puts out 115 PS and 144 Nm, and a new 1.5-litre turbo petrol engine which could put out around 160 PS of maximum power and 253 Nm of peak torque.Driving on India's largest Go-Kart track - Formula 11 Karting | TOI Auto3. Hyundai Ai3 Micro SUVHyundai is working on introducing a small SUV to rival Tata Punch and Maruti Ignis. The SUV was recently spied testing on international soil.Hyundai’s Ai3 micro SUV will be based on the same platform that underpins the newly launched Grand i10 Nios and the Aura. The Micro SUV is expected to measure around 3.7-3.8 meters in length. In terms of design, the Ai3 gets design cues borrowed from Venue. It features a split headlamp setup.Moving on to the side, the Ai3 gets 15-inch dual-tone alloy wheels and the front fenders and the front door look similar to the Hyundai Casper. At the back, it seems to have an angular design for its tail lamps. The car also features a sunroof and it is expected that Hyundai will offer more upmarket features compared to its rivals.Talking about the powertrain, the Ai3 is expected to be powered by the 1.2-litre NA VTVT Petrol engine that also powers up the Venue, Grand i10 and Aura. This engine produces 68 bhp of power and 95 Nm of torque. Hyundai might also offer a CNG variant with the Ai3.4. Honda’s new compact SUVHonda cars India shared a small tester of their upcoming compact SUV. The SUV was also spied testing on Indian roads recently hinting that the launch is imminent. When launched, the SUV will take on established players in the segment such as Hyundai Creta, Kia Seltos, Maruti Grace Vitara and Toyota Hyryder.When spotted, the SUV was heavily camouflaged so it’s hard to tell it’s design cues. The SUV is expected to get a split grille at the front with LED headlamps and DRLs. It is also expected to get 17-inch diamond cut alloy wheels and at the rear it’s expected to get wraparound taillamps. Talking about the powertrain, the SUV is expected to get same engine options as the 5th generation Honda City - a 1.5-litre V-TEC petrol engine and a 1.5-litre Atkinson cycle strong Hybrid petrol engine. 5. Hyundai Creta faceliftHyundai launched the face-lifted Hyundai Creta to the international markets in 2022. It was expected that the new Creta will make its debut at the Delhi Auto Expo. However, the company did not showcase the SUV. And now it is expected that Hyundai might launch the face-lifted Creta by the end of 2023 or in early 2024. Talking about the exterior, the updated Creta will get a large parametric grille with intergrated DRLs inspired by Tucson SUV. The SUV gets a redesigned tailgate with boomerang-shaped LED taillights and newly designed 17-inch alloy wheels.Moving on to the interior, the cabin layout will remain the same as before but the new Creta will receive a new colour scheme. The car gets a larger infotainment system with wireless Apple CarPlay/Android Auto and it also gets a fully digital instrument cluster similar to the Alcazar.It is expected that the updated Creta might get ADAS suite to make it much more safer. Features include adaptive cruise control, lane keep assist, rear cross-traffic collision, blind spot monitor, autonomous emergency braking with forward collision avoidance and more.Talking about the powertrain, the new Creta is expected to be powered by the same set of engines - a 1.5-litre turbo diesel, 1.5-litre NA petrol and a new 1.5-litre turbocharged petrol engine.Start a ConversationFOLLOW US ON SOCIAL MEDIAFacebookTwitterInstagramKOO APPYOUTUBE Visual Stories  Citroen eC3 vs Tata Tigor EV: Specs, range, price, battery pack and chargingautoCostliest luxury cars to buy in India: Rolls-Royce Black Badge Ghost to Maybach S-ClassautoHyundai, Kia cost India billions in trade deficit: Piyush Goyal’s statement explainedautoCoolest vintage cars that took part in Delhi's vintage car drive: Rolls-Royces, MustangsautoNumbers on car tyres and what they mean: Explained in picsautoTop 10 things to know about the upcoming Maruti Suzuki Jimny in picsautoIn images: New Royal Enfield Interceptor, Continental GT 650 twins coming soon!auto2023 Yamaha YZF R15 V4 on-road price in Delhi, Mumbai, Bengaluru and moreautoTop 10 upcoming electric cars in 2023: From Skoda Enyaq to Tata Altrozauto123ElectionsAssembly Elecetions 2023Elections 2023Nagaland Election ResultsMeghalaya Election ResultTripura Election ResultKarnataka Elections 2023Exit Polls 2023Tripura Exit PollsTop TrendingExit Polls 2023KL RahulPM Kisan SchemeManish SisodiaMumbai Train AccidentBihar Budget 2023 LiveTrending StoriesIn AutoEntire WebsiteUltraviolette starts deliveries of F77 electric motorcycle: Price, performance and specsCitroen eC3 vs Tata Tigor EV: Specs, range, price, battery pack and chargingCostliest luxury cars to buy in India: Rolls-Royce Black Badge Ghost to Maybach S-ClassYulu, Bajaj Auto launch two new electric 2-wheelers - text: Mumbai's Coastal Road: Cars will run from November 1 on Costal road | Mumbai News - Times of IndiaTop SearchesDelhi Excise Policy CaseMeghalaya EarthquakeMumbai Train AccidentManish Sisodia NewsLeh Ice Wall ClimbingBihar Budget 2023 LiveB S YediyurrappaEditionININUSSign  regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnapuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotoscivic issuescrimepoliticsschool and collegesmumbai mirrormaharashtra electionscitizen reportervideosphotosweatherpollution newseventsNewsCity Newsmumbai NewsCars will run on Mumbai's Coastal Road on November 1Cars will run on Mumbai's Coastal Road on November 1Richa Pinto / TNN / Updated: Feb 28, 2023, 09:15 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeARTICLESCars will run on Mumbai's Coastal Road on November 1ISB Digital Transformation Programme – Preparing working professionals to make their organisations future-readyKeni bowls JSW Steel into ‘E’ Div finalSensex in red for 7th day, at 1-month lowThe entry-exit ramps for the twin tunnels at Priyadarshini ParkBoring for the Coastal Road’s second tunnel is in the last stage. The work began last year and should be over by March, BMC officials say.The two tunnels1. Bored from Priyadrashini Park to Marine Drive*Jan 2021 | Tunnel boring machine (TBM) lowered from worksite near Priyadarshini Park *Jan 2022 | TBM emerges near Girgaum Chowpatty, finishing boring.2. Being bored from Marine Drive to Priyadarshini Park*March 2022 | Boring begins from Girgaum Chowpatty worksite*Work status | 164 metres left to be bored*March 2023 | Work expected to be finishedOngoing work Construction of utility boxes, road surfacing, cross-passageways, fire-fighting systems Cross passages: 13** **11 are within the tunnel and two within cut-and-cover entry and exitsCoastal Road project monster machineThe 10.6km underconstruction Coastal Road stretches from Princess Street on Marine Drive to the Worli-end of BandraWorli Sea LinkMonster machineThe tunnel boring machine (TBM) being used in the Coastal Road project is the biggest to be used so far in the city for any project.About the AuthorRicha PintoFollow OnRicha Pinto is a special correspondent with The Times of India. She covers urban governance & climate change issues. With over a decade of experience in field reporting, she has written extensively on various civic issues affecting Mumbaikars. She graduated in -journalism from the prestigious Mumbai-based St Xavier's College and later pursued a three-year Law degree (L.L.B.) with the University of Mumbai.
